Maira has her business located in a strategic spot in the community where many passers-by come to buy her fruit.  She needs the loan to buy watermelons, melons, oranges, bananas, apples, etc. to continue with the work that generates most of her income..

Maira hopes the loan will help her sales rise and it will be very useful because she does not have all the fruit needed to fill all her daily customer orders.  Thanks to this she’ll be able to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

Maira hopes in the short run to make the business grow to continue supporting her family and that her children have the necessary schooling so they will have greater opportunities in life.


Choluteca, Honduras – September, 2013

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Olga Isabel

texts.es: Olga, a sus 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 12 y 16 años. Por falta de oportunidades laborales su familia pasó por una difícil situación económica, y en su afán de generar recursos para el sustento de sus hijos, decide iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas rápidas en la acera de la casa donde vive, comenzó hace un año con unos ahorros que tenía y poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia en el manejo de este, por lo que su clientela ha ido aumentando. Trabaja todos los días a partir de las 3:00 pm y los fines de semana, recibe el apoyo de su hijo mayor. La cliente es una mujer luchadora, activa y emprendedora, siempre busca opciones que le permitan sacar adelante a sus hijos, aún sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le presentan, especialmente porque en la zona donde está ubicada, hay mucha competencia; sin embargo, se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el que desea comprar una nevera  e insumos al por mayor (carnes frías, panes, salsas, papas, aceite, gaseosas) así podrá continuar con su labor y tendrá la capacidad de brindar a sus clientes más variedad de productos y así aumentar sus ventas e ingresos, con los que continuará solventando los gastos familiares, pagando el colegio de sus hijos y fortaleciendo su negocio. Olga sueña con seguir adelante y poder tener una estabilidad económica favorable, que le permita en un futuro poder adquirir su casa propia para dar a sus hijos mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Olga, 39, is a single mother of two children who are 12 and 16 years old.  Because of the lack of employment opportunities her family went through a difficult economic situation.  Eager to generate income to support her children she decided to start her own fast-food business on the sidewalk where she lives.  She started a year ago with saving she had and gradually gained experience to better manage it and as a result her clientele has grown.

She works every day starting at 3pm and on weekends; her older son helps her.  She’s a hardworking, active, enterprising woman who always seeks opportunities that will allow her to move her children ahead overcoming various obstacles that arise especially because there is much competition in the zone she lives in.  Nonetheless, she’s encouraged to request the loan to buy a refrigerator and supplies at wholesale (cold-cuts, bread rolls, sauces, potatoes, oil, soft-drinks) to continue with her work and with the capacity to provide more variety of products to her customers thus increasing sales and profits to continue meeting family expenses like her children’s schooling and strengthening the business too.  Olga dreams with continuing forward to attain favorable economic stability in order to be able to buy a house of her own in future to provide better well-being and quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and to buy supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos, desde hace 6 años.
Doña María su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa habitación en el municipio donde vive y sus clientes son sus vecinos y personas de lugares cercanos que visita ofreciendo su producto. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de glases, cremas, lociones, perfumes, polvos, sombras, etc. productos que necesita para seguir realizando su trabajo.
Doña María con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes y gracias a esto espera poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia, espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en los estudios para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.




Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre del  2013
texts.en:
María is a very hard working and responsible person. She lives in a community in the south of Honduras with her family. She has had a business selling cosmetics for the last 6 years. María runs her business from her home in the municipality where she lives and she sells to neighbours and people living nearby whom she visits to sell her products.

María needs the loan to buy glosses, creams, lotions, perfumes, powders, eyeshadows etc., products which she needs so she can carry on with her business. She hopes that with the loan her sales will increase and this will help her a lot as she does not have all the products she needs to meet her customers' orders. Thanks to the loan she hopes to be able to improve her own and her family's quality of life a little. In the short term she hopes to grow her business so she can carry on supporting her children in their studies so that they can have better opportunities in life.



Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to buy glosses, creams, lotions, perfumes, powders, eyeshadows etc. for her business.

loans.name: Santos Antonia

texts.es:
La  señora Santos  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su esposo y sus hijos en  un caserío al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  venta cerdos y elaboración de tortillas.  
Doña Santos tiene más de 12 años de dedicarse a estas actividades. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de maíz,  leña, cal y  cerdos  para sus negocios.  Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y poder así atender mejor  a sus clientes.
Doña Santos espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en un negocio más grande y reconocido de la zona y que sus hijos  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la   sociedad.




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Septiembre   del   2013
texts.en:
Santos is a responsible, hard-working and honest woman.  She lives with her husband and children in a hamlet in the south of Honduras.  She has a business selling pigs and another making tortillas.

Santos has been doing these two kinds of work for over twelve years.  She needs a loan in order to buy corn, firewood, lime, and pigs, for her businesses.  With this loan she hopes that her sales will increase as she has more products to offer and is able to serve her customers better.

Santos is hoping to pay for necessities and to improve her and her family's quality of life a little.  In a few years she hopes that her business will continue to grow and be recognised in the area.  She hopes that her children will become good people, with better opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras. September 2013.

loans.use: to buy pigs, corn, firewood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy puppies.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: Eulalia, de 42 años, es una madre soltera que con esfuerzo, coraje y sacrificio pudo sacar adelante a sus tres hijos que ahora tienen 23, 20 y 16 años con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Eulalia consiste en la venta de comida, por las mañana ella venderá desayunos y al medio día almuerzos, ella realiza este trabajo sola  y espera le vaya bien ya que es nueva en esta actividad, tiene un espacio acondicionado en su casa para poder tener todas las comodidades para su trabajo. A Eulalia le gusta mucho cocinar y estar en contacto con la gente, esto le sirve como un factor determinante para que gane a sus clientes cada día, espera poder trabajar bien y generar muchas ganancias para solventar los gastos en su hogar, en le futuro quiere tener su restaurante formal y  poder hacer empresa en su distrito. Este es su sexto crédito con Kiva, por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. espera que los demás integrantes del grupo le ayuden a integrarse y a llevar el ritmo de trabajo que tienen y no fallarles. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles comprará, materiales para terminar sus sillas, ingredientes e insumos para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en: Eulalia, 42, is a single mother who, with effort, courage, and sacrifice, was able to progress with her children, who are now 23, 20 and 16 years old. She lives with them in her own house. Eulalia works selling food. In the morning, she will sell breakfast and at midday, lunch. She does this work on her own and hopes that it goes well for her because she is new to this activity. She has a space in her house set up to have all the conveniences for her work. Eulalia really likes to cook and interact with people. This is a determining factor so that she wins over customers every day. She hopes to be able to work well and earn a lot of money to meet her household expenses. In the future, she wants to have a formal restaurant and be able to do business in her district. This is her sixth loan with Kiva. This is why she is asking for their collaboration so that she can set up her plans. She hopes that the other members of the group help her to settle in and keep pace with the work and not let them down. With the 1,000 soles she has asked for, she will buy materials to finish her seats, and ingredients and supplies to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish her seats and ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline, a resilient married woman with four children, is tired of landlords who keep knocking at her house, day and night, asking for rent. She and her husband resorted to having a home of their own in order to raise their children in a decent environment and also to have peace, knowing that no one is coming to knock on their door, demanding rent. 

Jackline is hard-working and she thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited for giving her the opportunity of accessing a low interest loan to better the lives of her household. In the photo, Jackline is at the house under construction.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Amina

texts.ru: Амине 66 лет, разведена, одна воспитывает четырех детей. В 2004 году, начала бизнес в торговле продуктами питания на арендованном павильоне, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 5,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Амина имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 7,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, Амина смогла увеличить товарооборот и развить свой бизнес. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Амина обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота- оптовой покупки продуктов питания, для продажи с павильона, в розницу. Доходы от кредита Амина планирует вложить в товарооборот и накопить деньги на покупку дома для сына.
texts.en: Amina is 66 years old, divorced and raising four children alone. She started a business selling food products at a leased pavillion in 2004, using an initial capital of 5,000 som (KGS).  Having been able to grow her business and to obtain regular clients, Amina now has an average monthly income of 7,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Amina's hard work, she was able to increase her product turnover and develop her business.  In order to further grow and expand her business, Amina requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to increase product turnover by buying food products wholesale to be resold at retail prices at the pavillion.  Amina plans to invest the earnings from the loan into the product turnover and save money to purchase a house for her son.

loans.use: to increase product turnover by buying food products wholesale to be resold at retail prices

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married, with three children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items, like bread, charcoal, shampoo, sugar, and chips.

Josephine has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Josephine aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items, like bread, charcoal, shampoo, sugar, and chips.

loans.name: Halim

texts.ru: В районах и селах Республики Таджикистан основным видом деятельности является животноводство и растениеводство. Так же и в районе Хамадони большая часть народа имеет скотный двор или землю для посева. Халим один из жителей этого района. Он вот уже 10 лет занимается купле - продажей скота. В его бизнесе ему помогают двое его старших сына. Несмотря на то, что ему 69 лет он ухаживает за скотом сам. Халим просить кредит для закупа быков, чтобы увеличить поголовья скота. Халим старается все время работать и обеспечить свою семью, детей, внуков.
texts.en: Animal husbandry and agriculture are the primary types of businesses in the districts and villages of the Tajikistan Republic.  The majority of people in the Hamadoni district has a livestock yard or land for sowing.  Halim is one of the residents of this district.  He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for 10 years.  His two older sons help him with the business.  Despite the fact that he is 69 years old, he takes care of livestock himself.  Halim is requesting this loan to buy bulls in order to increase his livestock headcount.  Halim tries to work all the time and provide for his family, children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy bulls in order to increase his livestock headcount

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo de 46 años, esta casado con Sara con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 12, 07, 03 años y el último de 09 meses con quienes vive en su casa propia. EL trabajo de Guillermo como actividad principal consiste en la siembra de diferentes hortalizas. También se dedica a la  reparación de motores electrógenos, motos, maquinarias pesadas y otros, es muy bueno en lo que hace y es por eso que siempre le llaman para solucionar los problemas de las maquinas de sus clientes, pero lo que más le gusta es sembrar sus hortalizas ya que obtiene una buena ganancia de este trabajo. Este es su sexto crédito con Kiva, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado 1500 nuevos soles comprará abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 46, married to Sara has four children who are 12, 7 and 3 years old; his youngest is 9-months-old.  They all live with him in his own house.  Guillermo’s main work consists in growing various vegetables.  He also works repairing electric generators, motorcycles, heavy machinery and others.  He’s very good at what he does which is why his customers always call on him to solve problems with their machinery.  But what he enjoys the most is growing vegetables because he earns good profits from this work.

This is his 6th Kiva loan and he feels grateful for the support he gets to continue forward.  He also commits to make his payments punctually.  He will use the requested 1,500 new soles to buy organic manure for his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 27 years of age, married, and with two children who attend school, which is the reason for her hard work. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Margret has operated a cafe business, making consumables for sale to passersby and neighbors, like rice, tea, beans, and chapati ( flat bread). She cited seasonality as a major challenge.

With the KES 30,000 loan, Margret wants to purchase stocks of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and drinks for the business. Her dream is to see her child get a better education and to become an important person in the society.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and drinks for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like cloth.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 32 years old, and she did not attend school.  She is married with three children between 12 and 19 years old who are in school, and they all live at home. For the past two years she been selling charcoal in the local market. She started this business with a little money from her husband, and she learned the business from her friends. She sells from Monday to Saturday. spending nine hours each day on her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

Esther lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru: Рахматулло 27 лет. Семь из них он отдал семейному бизнесу. Он и его родители занимаются созданием национальных видов колыбелек. Рахматулло из древесины создает люльки, а его родители украшают колыбельку гравировками и красками. Один из этих робот вы видите на фотографии. Рахматулло пошел по стопам отца, который более 25 лет занимается созданием и декорации колыбелек. Раньше Рахматулло просто помогал отцу, и для него это было просто увлечением, но сейчас он знает, что хочет заниматься этим видом деятельности по жизни. На полученный кредит он закупит древесину и создаст более новые модели национальных колыбелек.
texts.en: Rahmatullo is 27 years old, seven of which he gave to a family business.  He and his parents are involved in making national types of bassinets.  Rahmatullo creates cradles from wood, and his parents decorate bassinets with engravings and paint.  You can see one of these creations on the photograph.  Rahmatullo followed his father's footsteps, who has been involved in creating and decorating bassinets for over 25 years.  Previously, Rahmatullo simply helped his father and it was just a hobby for him, but now he knows that he wants to be involved in this business for life.  He will use this loan to purchase wood and create newer models of bassinets.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fixed assets (a press) and parts and supplies (tires, motorcycle tires, spark plugs, lights, etc.).

loans.name: Elina

texts.en: Elina, a married mother of three, sells various items in her boutique.She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy more salt and sugar to sell. Elina has been running her enterprise for the past five years and plans to use the profits to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell such as salt and sugar

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 48 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of 6 and 24 years old, and they all live in Buchanan Ground Bassa county that is good at producing fish on the Liberian local market.

She was unfortunate to complete 7th grade, but she is good at managing her home and business. She has been running a shop where she sells food stuff such as rice, biscuits, vita, candy, oil, pepper, etc. for the past twenty-four years, and she learned this way of selling from her mother. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, biscuits, vita, candy, oil, pepper, etc. for her business. She likes her business because she has more customers and her daily saving is high. 

Her plans are to build her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, biscuits, vita, candy, oil, pepper etc. for her business.

loans.name: Naweh

texts.en: Naweh lives in Buchanan, the capital city of Ground Bassa County, which is an area that is good at producing fish in the Liberian local market. She is 27 years old and married with two children ages 4 and 1; only the older one is in school and they all live at home. For the past five years, she has been selling slippers in the local market. She enjoys the way her customers respond to her business, and she learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. She plans to build a house and educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky is 30 years old from Liberia, precisely she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital of Grand Bassa County along with her fiancee and three children between 2 to 12 years old. Her children live at home and attend school.

For the past four years, Pinky has sold fresh meat in the local market in order to help her children. She started this business by selling for her mother, and she learned the business from her. She appreciates her business because of the financial assistance her business gives her.  

Pinky is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh meat for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh meat for her business

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a 67-year-old poultry farmer who is married to Beatrice, and together they are blessed with one child. Titus has been practicing poultry farming for the past four years with a monthly income of  KES 10,000 which he uses for his family upkeep. 

Titus is applying for his first loan term with KADET. He will use the loan to buy more chicks and poultry feed.

With the expected profit from the business, he will open another poultry business in the neighborhood. 

His hopes and dreams are to be the best chicken meat supplier.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Nadutari

texts.en:
Nadutari is 23 years old, married, and the mother of three children ages seven, four and one. A mixed farmer for the last seven years, she earns a monthly income of KES 10000.


Nadutari has requested her first loan from KADET of KES 30000 to prepare her land and buy seedlings. She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. Her dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and prepare land for cultivation.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 47 years old and married with eight children.

Letecia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock, like canned goods, sugar, milk, soap, eggs, etc., to sell.

Letecia has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from farming rice and raising livestock.

Letecia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock, like canned goods, sugar, milk, soap, eggs, etc., to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has three children, of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a coconut selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 41 years old, married with three children between the ages of 23 and 14. Only one is in school, and they all live in Buchanan Ground Bassa county, which is known for producing fish on the Liberian local market.

Irene is a high school graduate, and has been selling rice by bag, sugar, flour, etc from a shop for the past two years now. She uses a bus to get her goods to her shop. 

She really faces a problem during the rainy season because the location of her business is not very good. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by bag, sugar, flour, etc to increase her sales. Her dream is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by bag, sugar, flour, etc to increase her sales.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Meet Richard. He runs a Zoona Mobile money transfer business in Chililabombwe. This is Richard’s second loan from Kiva; he sent in this update to his Kiva lenders and wanted the lenders to know this about him:

My name is Richard, I am widowed and have two lovely daughters and am currently living with one in Chililabombwe in the Copperbelt Province of Zambia.
Generally, I would say my business has not performed as expected. But with the help of the first Kiva loan, I made sure that much of the commissions earned were saved separately. I have since cleared the first loan. From the savings, I managed to pay for the Mobile Booth and got two more operations after an extensive surveying in the Copperbelt Province.
The greatest challenge I am facing now is the working capital to enable me to operate effectively. It is for this reason that I am applying for the second Kiva loan, so that I can top-up my working Capital to help me serve more customers. One thing I hate is to turn away Customers for the reasons that I do not have enough cash or the banks are closed. I have been with Zoona since 2009 and have helped some to join the business. I look forward to a long sustained relationship with both Kiva and Zoona. I love what I do in my business. That's providing an essential service required for most livelihoods in an easy, fast and safe way, with the advanced technology in the Mobile Business, everything is fascinating to say the least.
Hoping and dreaming to expand my business to greater heights, the expansion will help me to improve my family’s standard of living. Thank you.

loans.use: To grow his Zoona money transfer business by adding to his working capital which will allow him to serve more customers sending and receiving money at his shop

loans.name: Windor

texts.en:
Windor lives in Buchanan Ground Bassa county which is known for producing fish on the Liberian local market. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 7 and 28, all of whom live at home and only two attend school. 

For the past 13 years she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She established this business with a small loan from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes to expand her business.

In the future, she wants to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is a lady of thirty years, married to James and a mother of two children. She sells fruits and has now been in this business for thirteen years; she gets a monthly income of thirty three thousand shillings.

This will be Teresiah's second loan with KADET Ltd., she plans to use the entire loan to buy different types of fruits in bulk so that she can meet her customers' demands. 

In the future she plans to educate her children and improve on their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy assorted fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Los Progresistas De Cupiche Group

texts.es: El grupo “LOS PROGRESISTAS DE CUPICHE” está conformada por socios dedicados a diversas actividades del comercio minorista. Nélida tiene 40 años es soltera con una hijo universitaria y un bebe de 1 año. Hace 6 años implemento un restaurant en el cual ofrece desayuno almuerzo y cena y adicionalmente percibe otro ingreso de la venta de golosinas. Nélida maneja una cartera fija de clientes (transportistas). El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para su restaurant: papa, arroz, pollo. Nélida tiene una nueva meta para su familia que consiste en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Nélida es la cuarta del lado izquierdo viste polo negro y  buzo plomo.
texts.en: The “Los Progresistas de Cupiche” (Cupiche Progressive Ones) group consists of members who are dedicated to various retail commercial businesses.  Nélida, 40, is single with a daughter in university and a one-year-old baby.  Six years ago she opened a restaurant where she sells lunch and dinner; she earns extra money selling snacks.  Nélida has a regular clientele (transportation workers).  She will use the loan to buy ingredients like potatoes, rice and chicken for her restaurant.  Nélida has a new family goal which is to improve her children’s quality of life.  The group thanks Kiva lenders for the granted loan.  Nélida is fourth from the left wearing a black shirt and gray sweatpants.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, rice and chicken.

loans.name: Khusrav

texts.ru: Хусрав жизнерадостный и очень правильный мужчина в возрасте 27 лет.  Он женат и имеет 3х детей.  Живёт он со своей семьёй в маленькой деревушке.  Все свои силы Хусрав тратит на то, чтобы работать на благо и обеспечение своей семьи. Для получения дохода в семью, Хусрав занимается собственным делом.  Вот уже как 5 лет он занимается  животноводством. Этот вид бизнеса приносит хороший доход, но занимает много труда и заботы за скотом.  Раньше он занимался дехканством,  а  сейчас у него дома имеется несколько голов скота.  Также Хусрав дополнительно работает мастером и от этого также получает дополнительный доход.  Вместе со своими партнёрами они получают заказы на строительство мебели, и за это получают доход.  Сейчас Хусрав хочет расширить свой бизнес животноводства, увеличить поголовье своего скота и получать больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды и потребности своей семьи. Для этого он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Khusrav is a cheerful and very proper 27-year-old man.  He's married with 3 children.  He lives with his family in a small hamlet.  He directs all of his strength to the benefit and support of his family.  He makes income for the family with his own business.  For 5 years he has raised livestock, a business that brings in a good income but requires a lot of labor and worry over the animals.  In the past Khusrav made his living in animal husbandry but now he has a few head of livestock at home.  He also works as a craftsman from which he makes additional income.  He and his partners build furniture to order. 

Now Khusrav wants to expand his livestock business, increase his herd and earn more income so he can properly satisfy his family's needs. He has turned to Arvand and would like a loan to buy livestock to expand his business.  He thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Juan Santiago

texts.es: Don Juan ha trabajado toda su vida, su esposa una comprañera incondiconal en las buenas y malas, con este credito comprara insumos para establecer una manzana de Piña como: Hijos de Piña, Completo, Urea, Gesupax, Cypermetina y mano de obra, con esta cosecha espera obtener mejores ingresos ya que todavia tiene a su cargo dos de sus hijos ellos le ayudan con el trabajo en  la tierra y entre toda su familia luchan cada dia para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juan has worked his entire life.  His wife’s his unconditional partner in the good times and the bad.  He will use this loan to buy supplies like pineapple crowns, fertilizer, urea, Cypermethrin [insecticide] and Gesapax [herbicide] and to pay labor costs to start growing a 'manzana’ [Central American unit of land measurement] of pineapples.

He hopes to improve his income with this crop because two of his children who help him do the field chores are still dependent on him.  The entire family strives every day to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras De Patziquibala Group

texts.es:
La señora Ignacia esta unida de hecho. Tiene 45 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 3 hijos que no estan estudiando. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de sudaderos. Inició este negocio con la ayuda de su esposo y a la fecha lleva 8 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo y solocita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de materiales como hilos, telas, botones, entre otros, para la elaboración de sudaderos. Desea en el futuro tener un local grande en el municipio para poder obtener mejores ganancias.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y a la crianza de animales domésticos.
texts.en:
Ignacia is in a de-facto marriage.   She’s 45-years-old and never went to school.  She has three children who don’t attend school.  She works manufacturing sweatshirts.  She started the business with her husband’s help and to date has 8 years’ experience.  She relies on her husband’s support; he’s a merchant.

She formed a group and requested a loan she’ll use to buy supplies like thread, fabric and buttons, among others to make the sweatshirts.  She hopes in future to have a large locale in the municipality in order to earn higher profits.  

The other group members work in commerce and raising domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make sweatshirts.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a youth client of 26 years of age, from Iraq. He is married and is a father of a child.

Abbas owns a small café, where he offers hot and cold beverages for his customers with his unique services of the very famous Middle Eastern hubble-bubble. He has established his business in 2005 and, thanks to his very warm customer care, he became well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Abbas is requesting a youth loan of USD 2,200. He will use this loan to renovate his café and install a display window. Abbas is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he may be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his café and install a display window.

loans.name: Tamaraneh Kiss Town Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Fatmata was born in Makeni city 39 years ago. She is married and has 3 children, 2 of whom are attending primary and secondary school. Fatmata sells cashew nuts. 

This is the first loan that Fatmata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Fatmata will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to expand her business.  She will buy cashew nuts, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: buy cashews to resell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a lady of thirty-one years.  She is married to Amos and is a mother of four children.  She has rental houses and also sells fruits in Kinoo in the outskirts of Kangemi.  She gets monthly income of 45,000 shillings.

This will be Susan's second loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy different varieties of fruits to resell. In the future she wants to be successful in business.

loans.use: buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 21 years old. She sells plastic bags and containers. She has been in this business for the past three years. With this loan, she would like to buy more jerry cans and plastic containers for collecting rain water during winter time. She hopes to earn more profits from her business, which will be used to make savings for a better future.

loans.use: buy plastic containers to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, a 24-year-old married father of one from Thika, has a business as a dairy farmer.  He earns a monthly income of KES 7800, which he uses to support his family. This marks his first loan term with KADET after he was introduced by an existing KADET client. With the loan he has applied from KADET LTD, Charles will be able to purchase another dairy cow and containers for storing milk. 

The additional income created will allow Charles to improve the standard of living for his family and to reinvest in his business. In the future, Charles would like to buy more dairy cows to increase the production of milk to supply to his clients. 

His hopes are to become the leading milk supplier in his region.

loans.use: to buy more dairy cows

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace appreciates her previous loan which improved her living standards.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.  She would like to apply for another loan of KSH 40,000 to purchase more pigs for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: buy pigs to resell

loans.name: Yeremiah

texts.en: Yeremiah is a twenty-five-year-old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda.  For five years he has been selling clothes and from the proceeds he was able to buy a motorcycle, which he uses for transport.  Yeremiah desires to upgrade in his studies so as to get a good paying formal employment and also own a boutique despite inadequate capital. Yeremiah intends to use the loan to pay school fees for himself.

loans.use: to pay his school fees

loans.name: Ermelita

texts.en:
This is Ermelita, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joseph and is mother to their children. She, together with her husband,  manages their household while operating a business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Ermelita maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by  a dealer such as Ermelita, and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income.  Ermelita's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Ermelita is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

Ermelita hopes that her business will flourish and dreams to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a married Iraqi client who is 35 years old and has four children. He works hard to provide his family income alone while his wife takes care of their children. 

Haidar owns a small shop and sells women's clothing and cosmetics. He has excellent experience in this field, since he worked at several similar shops.  In 2007, Haidar established his own business and has earned an excellent reputation thanks to his very competitive prices. 

Haidar is requesting a loan of $2,400. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his family better living conditions and be able to continue to cover his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop

loans.name: Dakhel

texts.en:
Dakhel is from Iraq. He is 55 years old, married and has 3 children. Dakhel is the sole provider for his family and works hard to provide the school fees for his children.

Dakhel is a grocer and owns a small grocery store where he sells all the basic needs of a house like dairy products, juices, snacks and detergents. He  established his business in 2006 and since then he has been providing for his family through this business. He has good experience in this field and is well-known in the neighborhood.

Dakhel is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD in order to install ceramic blocks on the walls and on the floor of his grocery store, as well as to increase his selling goods inventory. Dakhel is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: improve his store and buy more inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has four children, three are in school and one is underage. They live in their own house which has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Elizabeth has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past four years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocery in the future.

With this KSH 45,000 loan, Elizabeth wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial supports.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Pari

texts.ru: Пари 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Пари - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Пари занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Пари, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, 3 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Пари обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Пари планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Pari is 50 years old, married, and is raising two children with her husband. Pari has a secondary education. The family's primary source of income is cattle breeding. Pari started her business ten years ago when she purchased of 1,000 KGS worth of cattle.  Due to Pari's hard work, her farm now has two milk cows, one calf, and three sheep. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Pari approached the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy cattle for cattle breeding. She plans to invest her profits in her business, increasing her livestock.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Pepe

texts.es:
Pepe, de 71 años de edad, está casado con Elsa con quien tiene 04 hijos los cuales  ya son mayores e independientes y viven con su propia familia. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus tres nietos. Pepe se dedica a la siembra de productos regionales, se dedica a cuidar sus terrenos en donde tiene todos estos productos para así obtener productos de calidad, además de contar con una pequeña tienda de comestibles. Le gusta mucho su trabajo por que tiene tiempo para poder hacer todas sus actividades y poder estar al lado de sus nietos, tiene buenos clientes a quienes atiende muy cordialmente los cuales están a la espera de su producción. Espera poder mantener el ritmo en su actividad económica porque tiene ingresos muy buenos y cono esto cubre los gastos diversos de su hogar. En está oportunidad se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.2000 soles, comprará abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Pepe is 71 years old and is married to Elsa. They have 4 children who are independent adults and who live with their own families. Pepe lives in his own house with his wife and his three grandsons. Pepe works growing regional products and taking care of his land to ensure the high-quality of his products. In addition, he owns a little grocery store. He enjoy is work very much because he has enough time to complete all his activities and spend time with his grandsons. He has good clients whom he takes care of personally and in a friendly way and who are always waiting for Pepe's products. He hopes to keep the rhythm of his economic activity because he receives high incomes which allow him to pay his many living expenses. He is very grateful for this opportunity and for the financial help he is receiving to continue with his business. Also, he commits to paying his fees on time. With the requested amount, S/.2000 soles, he will buy organic fertilizer for his land.

loans.use: Compra de abono orgánico.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат работает учительницей в школе. Она более двадцати лет преподает. Шарофат правильно воспитала своих шестерых детей. Ее сыновья работают заграницей, дочери вышли замуж. Они все помогают своей матери. Ее муж тоже преподаватель. Он работает в Технологическом Университете района Хамадони. Дети Шарофат взрослые и у нее имеется много свободной времени. Свое свободное время она не собирается тратить в пустую и берет кредит для приобретения швейной машины. У Шарофат есть швейная машина производства СССР, но она не пригодна для использования. С помощью швейной машинки она хочет отдать все свое свободное время шитью национальных платьев. Она намерена начать шить и вышивать платья.
texts.en: Sharofat works as a school teacher. She has taught for over twenty years. Sharofat raised her six children well. Her sons are working abroad, and her daughter got married. They all help their mother. Her husband is also a teacher. He works at the Technological University of Hamadoni. Sharofat's children are grown, and she has a lot of free time. She is not going to spend this time idly, so she is taking out a loan to buy a sewing machine. Sharofat has a sewing machine that was manufactured in the USSR, but it is not suitable for professional use. When she gets a sewing machine, she wants to use all of her free time sewing traditional dresses. She is going to start sewing and embroidering dresses.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine so she can make traditional dresses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for desserts, a special refrigerator for flowers and arrangements, materials for decorations and arrangements, shelving, and advertising.

loans.name: Begaiym

texts.ru: Бегайым 50 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Бегайым - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бегайым занимается животноводством, стартовав 25 лет назад, с покупки скота на 400 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бегайым, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 телено, 5 овец, 2 ягненка, 3 козы, 5 козлят. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бегайым обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бегайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Begayym is 50 years old, a widow.  Since her husband's death, she has been single-handedly raising three children and tending her own farm. Begaiym has a secondary education. Animal husbandry is the family's primary source of income. Begaiym started this business 25 years ago with cattle she bought for  400 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Begaiym's farm now has two milk cows, one calf, five sheep, two lambs, three goats, and five kids. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Begaiym asked the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 135,000 KGS to buy calves for cattle breeding. Begaiym plans to use income from the loan to further increase her cattle.

loans.use: buy calves

loans.name: Mansuba

texts.ru:
Мансуба живет со своими детьми в районе Хамадони. Она мать четверых детей. Ее муж работает автомехаником в городе Душанбе и высылает деньги ей и ее детям. Мансуба нигде не работала и не работает. Она хочет по быстрее это исправить. 
Мансуба берет кредит на сумму 1000 долларов США с целью купить швейную машинку, аксессуары, материалы и начать зарабатывать. Мансуба умеет шить, но к сожалению, швейную машинку не имеет. Если бы у нее была машинка, она могла сидеть дома одновременно следить за своими маленькими детьми и брать заказы для шитья.
texts.en:
Mansuba lives with her children in Hamadoni. She is the mother of four children. Her husband is an auto mechanic in Dushanbe and sends money to her and her children. Mansuba has never worked and does not currently work. She wants change this as soon as possible.

Mansuba is taking out a loan for $1,000 to buy a sewing machine, accessories, and fabric to start making money.  Mansuba knows how to sew, but unfortunately does not have a sewing machine. If she had a machine, she could take commissions for sewing while she stays at home with her small children.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine, accessories, and fabric.

loans.name: Group 9 At Lien Mac 1

texts.en: Lan, pictured second from the left, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of about $24 (500,000 VND).  She is 52 years old and has two grown children.  Her family has never owned a hygienic latrine.  She recently joined a campaign to improve the community's sanitation and hygiene through her local Women's Union, where she has been a member since 1983.  With this loan, Lan will build a hygienic toilet that will improve her family's quality of life.  A group of 10 neighbors, including Lan, are requesting a loan to install toilets at each of their homes.  This means the community as a whole can avoid the common diseases and infections associated with the unhygienic latrines they are currently using. *Please note, the person on the far left is not a borrower, but a local resident.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of hygienic toilets

loans.name: Oydona

texts.ru: Ойдона до недавних пор занималась растениеводством и выращивала овощи на своей земле. У нее нет мужа, и поэтому многие обязанности по хозяйству она берет на себя. Ойдона 10 лет проработала трактористкой. До сегодняшних дней одна занимается выращиванием овощей. Ойдоне 53 года она не останавливается на достигнутом и хочет параллельно открыть свой бизнес по купле и продажи крупнорогатого скота. Она уже успела купить сено и корм, а коровник у нее имеется, остается только взять кредит для закупа коров. Она надеется в свою удачу, а мы желаем ей успеха.
texts.en: Oydona has long farmed vegetables on her land. She does not have a husband, and so she takes the many responsibilities on the farm on herself.  Oydona drove a tractor for ten years. To this day she farms vegetables. Oydona is 53 years old, but she's not slowing down. She wants start an additional business buying and selling cattle. She has already managed to buy hay and feed, and she has a barn.  She is only borrowing money to buy cows. She is hoping for luck, and we wish her success.

loans.use: start a new business buying and selling cattle.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is an Iraqi youth client, who is 23 years old, married, and has a child. Safaa works hard to provide for his family’s needs with the profits he gains from his carpentry.

In his carpentry, Safaa specializes in making furniture, doors, and windows, using modern methods. He has been in this field since his childhood and he has established his own, independent business in 2010. He now has two hired employees and is well-known in the neighborhood, with an excellent reputation.

Safaa is applying for a youth loan of USD 2,400. The aim of this loan is to buy a piece of equipment which is specialized for his work. Safaa believes that this loan will positively affect a change in his current financial conditions since it will increase his production. With the increase in his profits, Safaa will be able to take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy a piece of equipment which is specialized for his work.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will replace the use of candles and flashlights

loans.name: Sheraton Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her mid-30s, is single, with a boy who is in nursery school. 

For 11 years now, Fatuma has been running a business, selling clothes (football jersies) and honey. She obtains her honey stock from up-country and she sells it wholesale. Fatuma works from 9am to 4pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is her seventh loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start her business of selling honey and to restock with more clothes. She managed to successfully pay back all her previous loans. The business profit earned was used to cover school fees and household expenses. She saved the remaining amount. 

Fatuma will use this loan to restock more clothes to sell. She dreams that, one day, she will be able to open a big clothes shop. 

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group, Sheraton Group, which totals eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Las Señoras De Lucumo Group

texts.es: Apolonia  es socia del grupo “Las Señoras De Lúcumo” conformada por 05 mujeres  trabajadoras que pasan a su 7 ciclo. Apolonia de  56 años es casada con 01 hijo  independiente. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, la cual cada vez ha ido mejorando. Se siente feliz pues gracias a su esfuerzo puede seguir apoyando a su familia. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de abarrotes y bebidas. Seguir implementando su negocio es el mayor deseo de Apolonia. El grupo “Las Señoras De Lúcumo” están agradecidos con el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso. Apolonia es la primera del lado derecho y viste chompa verde. En la parte superior esta Ana, pues no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Apolonia is a member of the "Las Señoras de Lúcumo" group which is made up of 5 working women and is in its 7th cycle.  Apolonia is 56 years old, married and has one son who is independent.  For over 10 years, she has dedicated herself to selling basic products.  She feels very happy because thanks to her efforts she has been able to continue to support her family.  

She is seeking this loan to purchase groceries and beverages.  Apolonia's greatest wish is the continued existence of her business.  The "Las Señoras De Lúcumo" group is very grateful for the loan they have received because it has made progress possible.  

In the picture, Apolonia is the first woman on the right and is dressed in a green sweater.  At the top is Ana, she was not able to appear for the picture because she was working.

loans.use: purchase groceries and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to acquire a solar home system and make a positive change in their family's quality of life

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a 26-year-old married woman with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells firewood and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her children. High transportation costs plus high taxes and strict laws regarding cutting trees are her major challenges

Doreen is applying for a 400,000 UGX loan through HOFOKAM to buy additional firewood to sell. Her ambition is to transition into a solar business after accumulating enough capital.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es: Carmen a sus 50 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos y cabeza de hogar, luego de la separación con su esposo. Hace dos años inició su propio negocio con apoyo de su hijo mayor, como una opción para generar ingresos y emplear su tiempo en alguna actividad, por lo que montó una tienda de belleza en la cual trabaja sola todos los días desde las 9:00 am y hasta las 7:00 pm; allí ofrece diversos productos de belleza como tinturas, cosméticos, esmaltes para uñas, shampoo, tratamientos capilares, entre otros. La cliente es una mujer activa y pujante, se proyecta hacia el cumplimiento de sus metas; razón por la cual se decide a tomar el crédito como apoyo para seguir progresando. El dinero será invertido en la compra de surtido al por mayor (tinturas, tratamientos capilares, esmaltes para uñas, cosméticos) y accesorios de bisutería para, así podrá obtener los artículos a menor costo y  podrá ofrecer más variedad de productos, lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento del margen de ganancias que obtiene por cada venta, dando como resultado mayor nivel de ingresos. De esta manera tendrá la opción de mejorar sus finanzas personales y evitará depender de sus hijos quienes le han colaborado económicamente durante varios años. Carmen desea seguir trabajando arduamente para llegar a cumplir el sueño de acreditar, fortalecer y hacer crecer su negocio hasta el punto de montar más sucursales, que le generen mayor rentabilidad y donde pueda ofrecer oportunidades de empleo a más mujeres cabeza de familia; así mejorará la calidad de vida tanto de su familia, como de las otras personas que influyan en esta labor.
texts.en:
Carmen, 50 years old, is mother to three children and has been the head of her household from the time of her separation from her husband. Two years ago she opened her own business with the support of her oldest son. As an option to generate an income and employ her time in some activity, she opened a beauty supply store in which she works alone every day from 9:00 am to 7:00 pm. There, she offers a variety of beauty supplies like dyes, cosmetics, nail polishes, shampoo, and hair treatments, among others. 

The client is an active and thriving woman. She is throwing herself into reaching her goals, which is the reason for which she decided to take the loan to support her continued progression. The money will be invested in the purchase of supplies wholesale (dyes, hair treatments, nail polishes, cosmetics) and costume jewelry accessories.  Thus, she will be able to obtain the items at a lower cost and will be able to offer a larger variety of products, which will be seen reflected in the increase of the profit margin that she obtains from each sale, giving a higher income level as a result. In this way, she will have the option to improve her personal finances and will avoid depending on her children who have economically collaborated with her for many years.

Carmen wishes to continue working arduously to arrive at the completion of her dream of accrediting, strengthening, and growing her business to the point of opening more stores, which will generate more profitability and where she would be able to offer business opportunities to more head-of-household women. In this way, she will improve the quality of life as much for her family as for other people who have influence in this line of work.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (dyes, hair treatments, nail polishes, cosmetics) and costume jewelry accessories.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is married with six children. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Patience has sold clothes for the past three years. She sells from a shop to town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces the major challenge of inflation in her business.

Patience decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. she is applying for a 50,000 KES loan to buy additional bales of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy additional bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Selmita

texts.es: Selmita, de 52 años, esta casada con Carlos y tiene un hijo de 19 años con quien vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Selmita consiste en la venta de productos comestibles, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, donde también ofrece algunos productos por catalogo a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, ella también posee una mototaxi que alquila a una persona de confianza. Lleva más de 18 años haciendo todo de tipo de trabajo el cual hace sola ya que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y pasa mucho tiempo en su chacra. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede ganar dinero estando en su casa, compartiendo el tiempo junto a su hijo quien en algunas ocasiones sale también a trabajar en la mototaxi que tiene. En el barrio su bodega es muy concurrida ya que trata bien a sus clientes y tiene todo lo que ellos necesitan por lo que tiene buenos ingresos y le va bien en esta actividad económica, espera mas adelante poner un negocio como es la venta de repuestos de mototaxis y una  vulcanizadora. Este  será su crédito  número 06 con Kiva.  Por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado 600 soles, comprará productos comestibles para su bodega tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros.
texts.en:
Selmita, 52 years old, is married to Carlos and has one 19-year-old son with whom she lives in her own home. Selmita’s work consists of the sale of grocery products. She has a small store in her home, where she also offers some products from catalogs for her customers, the majority of whom are her friends, neighbors, and relatives. She also possesses a motorcycle taxi that she rents to a trustworthy person. 

She has been working all types of jobs for more than 18 years. She has worked alone since her husband makes a living in agriculture and spends much of his time on his farm.  What she likes about her work is that she can make money while being in her home, spending time with her son who on some occasions also goes out to work on the motorcycle taxi that she has. In her neighborhood her grocery store is very crowded since she treats her customers well and has everything they need. She has a good income and it is going well for her in this economic activity.

She hopes to later open a business in the sale of motorcycle taxi spare parts and a tire repair shop. This will be her sixth loan with Kiva. Because of this, she is requesting Kiva’s cooperation to be able to concrete her plans. With the amount requested of 600 Nuevo Soles, she will buy food products for her grocery store like rice, sugar, and milk, among others.

loans.use: to buy food products such as rice, sugar, and milk, among others.

loans.name: Yafesi

texts.en:
Yafesi (pictured with his wife) has been a banana farmer since he was a teenager. His banana plantation has remained his sole source of income.

Yafesi is dealing with banana wilt, which is damaging his trees. He is applying for a 2,000,000 UGX loan through UGAFODE to hire laborers to uproot the infected trees and then replace them with new banana plants. He believes this will solve his problem once and for all.

Yafesi is grateful to UGAFODE for giving him a second chance with his plantation. With this loan he will be able to increase his yields and income so as to meet his family’s needs.

loans.use: to hire laborers to uproot infected trees and replace them with new ones

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, de 55 años, está divorciado de la madre de sus hijos  con quien tiene tres hijos que ya son mayores e independientes, el vive en los terrenos de su jefe ya que trabaja cuidando estos terrenos , en donde el también lo utiliza para sus sembríos y como granja de sus animales. El trabajo de Carlos consiste en la siembra y cosecha de cítricos, y algunos productos regionales como yuca, plátano, ají y otros, además cría animales como gallinas, patos, pollo, vacas, etc. Este trabajo lo realiza en la chacra de su patrón ya que el es empleado y a cambio el puede utilizar la tierra del fundo para sembrar sus productos además de criar en el sus animales. Realiza su trabaja solo y cuando es necesario contrata trabajadores del lugar para poder ayudarlo en la siembra. Le gusta mucho su trabajo por que está siempre en la naturaleza, además que tiene tiempo libre para muchas actividades, espera mantenerse con su producción y poder comprar mas adelante sus propios terrenos. En está oportunidad se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.2500 soles, comprará abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 55 and divorced from the mother of his three adult children, who live on their own. Carlos lives on land owned by his employer, where he does farm labor and also grows his own crops and cares for his own animals. 

Carlos plants and harvests citrus fruits and a variety of regional crops, including yucca, bananas, peppers, and others. He also raises chickens, turkeys, cows, and other animals. Carlos's employer allows him to raise animals and crops on a plot of land in exchange for Carlos's work on the employer's farm. Carlos works his plot independently and only hires temporary laborers to help with plantings. He enjoys farming tremendously as he's always in a natural environment and has time to do many other things. 

Carlos hopes to maintain production and be able to purchase his own land in the future. He will use the loan funds, 2,500 soles, to purchase organic manure for planting. He is grateful for the financial support he's receiving that will allow him to move forward.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Nueva Esperanza” está conformada por 08 socios responsables que han ido mejorando a través de sus negocios. Este es el caso de Gloria la cual comenzó apoyando en la elaboración de chocolates, tiempo después con los conocimientos adquiridos  decidió independizarse, pues actualmente ofrece sus chocolates elaborados por ella. Este negocio le ha permitido mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de azúcar,  chocolates, empaques y moldes. Implementar su negocio es su anhelo. Gloria es casada y tiene 04 hijos, 03 de ellos aún dependiente. El grupo “Nueva Esperanza” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Gloria se encuentra sentada es la primera persona del lado derecho, viste polo rojo y chaleco morado.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank is made up of eight responsible members who have been improving themselves through their businesses.  This is the case of Gloria who started out by helping to make chocolates; then a while later she decided to go out on her own with the knowledge she had learned. Now she sells her own chocolates that she makes herself..

This business has enabled her to improve her family’s quality of life. Her latest loan will be used to purchase sugar, chocolate, packaging and molds. She aspires to carrying out her business. Gloria is married and has four children, three of whom are still dependents.

The Nueva Esperanza group is grateful to the people who made this loan possible. Gloria is shown seated, the first person on the right, dressed in a red tee shirt and a purple vest.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, chocolate, packaging and molds.

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAS HORMIGUITAS” esta conformada por 09 socias trabajadoras y emprendedoras quienes realizan actividades y prestan servicios. Miluska tiene 41 años es soltera con 03 hijos de las edades de 24 años, 22 años y una menos de 15 años a quien educa. Miluska hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de comida rápida en su vivienda  actividad que aprendió de su madre. Es de esta manera que a podido ser madre y padre para su tres hijos. miluska se siente muy feliz ya que sus dos hijos son profesionales. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una nueva refrigeradora para vender gaseosas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Muliska es la primera persona sentado en lado  derecho.
texts.en: The “Las Hormiguitas” (Little Ants) group consists of nine hardworking, enterprising members who carry out activities and provide services.  Miluska, 41, is single with three children aged 24, 22 and the youngest who is 15 and still going to school.  Miluska has sold fast-food at home for 20 years, an activity she learned from her mother.  This is how she’s been able to be both mother and father to her three children.  Miluska feels very happy that her two children are professionals.  She will use the loan to buy a new refrigerator to start selling soft-drinks.  The group thanks Kiva lenders for the granted loan.  Miluska is seated first on the right.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator.

loans.name: Danieska Del Socorro

texts.es: Danieska es originaria de la ciudad  de chontales. Tiene 23 años de edad, casada, madre de 2 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, computadoras y celulares, desde hace 5 años. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos.  Tiene como otra fuente de ingresos remesas que recibe de su esposo. Solicita el crédito para comprar: blusas, camisas, ropa interior, cartera, zapatos, sandalias entre otros con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y cumplir con sus pedidos. Estima que el financiamiento será de mucha ayuda para aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su plan futuro es comprar un terreno para construir su casa y su meta próxima es ahorrar  dinero e independizarse para dejar de realizar créditos.
texts.en:
Danieska’s from the city of Chontales.  She’s 23-years-old, married and mother of two children.   She’s a merchant by profession and has sold clothes, shoes, computers and mobile phones for the last five years.  Her husband and children help her out.  She has another source of income which is the stipends she receives from her husband.

She’s asking for the loan to buy blouses, shirts, underwear, purses, shoes and sandals aiming at meeting customer needs and filling their orders.  She feels that the loan will be of much help to increase income and improve her quality of life.  Her future plan is to buy a piece of land to build a house on and her next goal is to save money to become independent and leave loans behind.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Hien's Group

texts.en:
Hien was born in 1967. She has three children who have their own families. Her husband is a driver of a passenger car. His income is about 5,000,000 VND per month. Hien makes package to earn a living. She has done this job for 20 years. She earns about 3,500,000 VND per month. Her family’s total income is about 12,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in work is lacking capital to buy more materials to make package. Her dream is her business to be more favorable and her house more spacious. This loan is one steps toward helping her reach her dream. Hien is a hard-working woman.
She has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2008. In the last loan, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid it on time. With this loan, she wants to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more materials to make bags. She wants to expand her business scale.
The other member of Hien's group is Xoa, who is 31 years old and has two children. She is a carpenter and wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy more wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make bags.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marjorie works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and a general store. Marjorie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she is requesting a new loan to further build her fishing, pig-raising and general store businesses.

Marjorie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials, like fishing nets, bamboo, nylon, etc

loans.name: Dina Ruth

texts.es:
Dina de 48 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 3 hijas, dos de ellas están con su esposo en los estados unidos y la otra vive en la casa, la hija que esta con ella trabaja como enfermera y tiene un  hijo. Dina además de ser ama de casa, cuida el ganado que posee y presta servicio de molienda, con un molino de nixtamal que tiene en su casa.

Para comprar el alimento  del ganado, lo hace en la zona y si no le toca trasladarse en vehículo a la ciudad, cerca de 3 km de su casa. 

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de insumos para el ganado, concentrados, vitaminas, medicina y asegurar la salud y una mayor producción de este.

En un futuro piensa solicitar otro préstamo, para renovar los lotes de ganado, y asegurar la sostenibilidad de la ganadería.
texts.en:
Dina, 48, is married and has three daughters.  Two of them are with her husband in the United States and the other one lives at home.  The daughter that lives with her works as a nurse and has a son.  In addition to being a housewife, Dina raises cattle and provides milling services with a corn mill she has at home.   She buys the cattle feed locally but if it’s unavailable she has to go to the city by car, a distance of almost 3 kilometers from home.

The loan will be used to buy cattle feed, concentrate, vitamins and medicine to insure their health and greater production.  In future, she plans to request another loan to renew her cattle herd and insure the sustainability of the cattle ranch.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine and vitamins for the cattle.

loans.name: Saroen's Group

texts.en:
Saroen, age 48, is living in a rural village in the Ponhea Leur district and has 10 children. She and her husband are farmers who have been growing rice for two years. To better support her family, she has been working as a garment worker. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Saroen is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for constructing a proper latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine for use by her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for constructing a proper and clean latrine for her family.

loans.name: José Leoncio

texts.es:
José de 41 años de edad, es casado y ha procreado dos hijos de 8 y 9 años de edad. Desde  muy joven y por necesidad viajo al extranjero, para ahorrar dinero durante diez años, luego regreso al país y con los ahorros instalo una tienda la que está a cargo de su esposa, quien además vende tortillas todos los días. 

Actualmente él se dedica a trabajar la tierra. José vive a 12 km de la ciudad más cercana, se traslada en automóvil para  llegar y comprar lo que necesita para mantener la tienda

El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de productos para la tienda, tres sacos de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra, para su cultivo. Al poder sacar la cosecha podrá asegurar el alimento de su familia y también la sostenibilidad de la tienda. 

Como objetivo José quiere lograr que sus hijos terminen sus estudios, y tener una tienda más fuerte que sea reconocida como la tienda principal de la zona.
texts.en:
José, 41, is married and  has had two children who are 8 and 9 years old.  At a very young age he traveled abroad to save money for ten years. He then returned to the country and used those savings to open a store his wife manages; she also sells tortillas every day.

He currently works in agriculture.  José lives 12 kilometers from the nearest city and travels there by car to buy what he needs to keep the store going.  

He will use the loan to buy stock for the store, three sacks of fertilizer and to pay labor costs for the crop.  With a successful harvest he will be able to guarantee food for his family and also the store’s sustainability.  José’s goal is that his children complete their schooling, to have a stronger store that’s known as the zone’s main one.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for the store, three sacks of fertilizer and to pay labor costs for the crops.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas, a 25-year-old youth client from Iraq, is married and has a child for whom he works hard to provide. He owns a small shop that specializes in selling spare parts for motorcycles. With a passion for motorcycles since his childhood, he spent most of his time at a friend’s garage aiming to learn more about them.

In 2010 Abbas established his own business and opened his own garage. He has earned an excellent reputation and now has one employee. He is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD through CHF to pay the annual rent on his shop.

Abbas is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he can both take better care of his parents and his family and provide for all of their needs.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his shop

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married with three children, two of whom go to school. The family lives in a rented house and has access to electricity and piped water. Their monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

For the past thirteen years Amina has sold used clothes. She works at the market every day of the week buying clothes at wholesale prices and selling them at retail. Her major business challenges include thieves, seasonality and transportation.

Amina has applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX through MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She aspires to start importing used cloths as well as buying a plot of land upon which to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Santiago Jhonatan

texts.es:
Santiago es un joven de 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de carhuaz y para pode salir adelante trabaja como chofer de taxi, asimismo con los ingresos de su humilde trabajo se encuentra estudiando la carrera de ingeniería civil; Santiago cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque es muy responsable.
