Santiago está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva podrá solventar sus gastos para la compra de materiales de estudio, de esta manera podra tener los implementos necesarios para desarrolla sus clases y poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Ser un gran profesional”.
texts.en:
Santiago, 21, is a young man living in the city of Carhuaz who works as a taxi driver to get ahead.  Also, he’s using his humble earnings to study Civil Engineering.  Santiago believes he’s doing well because he’s kind to his customers and because he’s very responsible.

Santiago is very grateful to Kiva lenders because he’ll be able to pay for his study materials thus having what he needs to do his classwork and continue striving to make his greatest dream reality: to become a great professional.

loans.use: to buy study materials.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia  de 48 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos, uno de tiene 20 años de edad y el menor de 12 ambos  estudian. Su esposo trabaja en la unidad de salud.Ella tiene 15 años de experiencia en el oficio de la costura, elabora uniformes de centros educativos que la contratan, oficio que primeramente aprendió con la mamá y luego se especializó en un curso de corte y confección.
    
Se traslada desde su casa hasta el punto de venta más cercano en la ciudad, viaja por medio de autobús comprando 200 yardas de tela para uniformes y en conjunto compra zippers y los broches que llevan los pantalones, de igual forma compra la tela de las camisas y botones.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de agroquímicos para mantenimiento de cultivo de maíz, 4 sacos de fertilizantes y el pago de mano de obra.

El préstamo mejorara la calidad de vida, porque la cosecha que esperan obtener es para consumo familiar, así no tendrán que comprar el maíz que posiblemente este más caro
En el futuro, Florencia planea solicitar un nuevo préstamo para reparar su casa y vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Florencia, 48, is married and has two children; one is 20-years-old and the younger one is 12.  Both attend school.  Her husband works in a health clinic.  She has 15 years’ experience as a seamstress.  She manufactures uniforms for schools that contract with her, an occupation she initially learned from her mother and then perfected by taking clothes-making courses.

She heads from home to the city’s nearest sales point by bus to buy 200 yards of uniform fabric and also buys zippers and  clasps for the pants; she also buys fabric for shirts and buttons.

The loan will be used to buy chemical fertilizers for her corn crop, four sacks of fertilizer and to pay labor costs.  

The loan will improve her quality of life because the harvest they expect to get will be used for family consumption so she won’t have to buy corn which will be more expensive perhaps.  In future, Florencia plans to request a new loan to repair her house to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius, 57, is a father of one in Matuu. He is married to Mirriam, a business lady. For the past thirteen years Julius has been operating a welding workshop. It earns him a monthly income of 19,500 KES which he uses to provide for his family.

After being introduced by a staff member to KADET, Julius is applying for his first loan. He will use the 70,000 KES loan to buy more metal and a new welding machine. He will reinvest in his business with his anticipated profits.

His hopes and dreams are to have a comfortable family life and an established welding business.

loans.use: to buy more metal and a new welding machine

loans.name: Víctor Alfonso

texts.es: Víctor es un hombre casado, con 29 años de edad. Es propietario de una legumbrería que inició en el año 2011; el negocio se encuentra ubicado en el sector central del municipio donde reside, trabaja todos los días, ofrece todo tipo de frutas y verduras. Cuenta con el apoyo de una empleada que trabaja por turnos, ya que él, además de tener su negocio, trabaja como conductor y vendedor de mercancía, actividades con las que complementa los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su familia. El cliente es activo, trabajador, humilde y alegre, se esmera por mantener su negocio en funcionamiento, aún sobrepasando los obstáculos que se le presentan, especialmente con la competencia que tiene el sector; sin embargo esto no lo desanima, por el contrario lo motiva cada día para seguir luchando. Solicita el apoyo del crédito ya que desea realizar unas mejoras locativas y comprar surtido al por mayor (frutas y verduras en general), así dará una mejor imagen al establecimiento y podrá tener disponibilidad de diversos productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, dando como resultado un incremento en el margen de utilidades por venta. Víctor sueña con acreditar y fortalecer aún más su negocio, para que en un futuro le dé la opción de ampliarlo y generar más empleos; además podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y disfrutar de un mejor bienestar en compañía de su esposa.
texts.en:
Victor is married and 29 years old. He is the proprietor of a vegetable store he started in 2011. His business is located in the central section of the city where he lives. He works every day and sells all kinds of fruit and vegetables. He has one employee who works in shifts because in addition to owning his business, he also works as a driver and a seller of merchandise, other jobs he has that supplement his earnings to support his family. 

Victor is active, hardworking, unassuming and happy. He goes to a lot of effort to keep his business functioning while overcoming the obstacles he encounters, especially the competition he faces in the sector. Nevertheless, he does not let this get him down but rather it motivates him each day to continue striving.

He is requesting this loan because he wants to make improvements to his business and buy supplies wholesale (generally fruit and vegetables). In this way his establishment will have a better image and he will have a variety of products available to satisfy his customers’ needs. This should result in an increase in sales and his profit margin.

Victor dreams of accrediting and strengthening his business even more so that in the future he has the option of expanding it and generating more jobs. As well he will be able to have a better quality of life and, along with his wife, enjoy greater well being

loans.use: to make improvements to his business and to purchase supplies wholesale (generally fruit and vegetables).

loans.name: Dramane

texts.fr: Agé de 34 ans, DRAMANE a une épouse et est père de 4 enfants. Il  vit dans une famille polygame avec sa famille dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). Mr Dramane mène des activités de commerce notamment la vente d’articles divers de boutique depuis plus de 5 ans. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenus, sa demande est souvent très grande, car il reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité,  DRAMANE a fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso.  IL est à son  2ème prêt   en individuel. Ce prêt sera  utilisé pour l’acquisition des stocks de  diverses marchandises (thé, sucre, savon, lait en poudre, céréales, pâtes dentifrices, etc). Il s’approvisionne auprès  des grossistes de Koutiala et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique à Koutiala à une clientèle mixte, en espèce et en détail. Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, DRAMANE envisage réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel de 45.000 FCFA  qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des intérêts de Soro, satisfaire aux besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Dramane is 34 years old, married, and has four children. He lives in a polygamous family in the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region). 

For over five years, Mr. Dramane has been running a business – namely a sundries shop. This business brings him enough revenue, and demand for his goods is often high as he has a number of clients a day. 

He is working with the mircrofinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy his customers and grow his business. This is his second individual loan. He will use this loan to buy sundries (tea, sugar, soap, powdered milk, cereals, toothpaste, etc.) He buys his supplies from wholesalers in Koutiala, and sells out of his shop in Koutiala to a mixed clientele for cash and at retail prices. 

With the growth of his business, Dramane would like to earn an average monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA that he will use to repay interest to Soro, satisfy the needs of his family, and invest in his business.

loans.use: buy sundries for his shop.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis de 27 años de edad, realizo sus estudios hasta sexto grado, tiene seis años de vivir con su pareja, con la que procrearon dos hijas una de 3 años y la otra de 1, únicamente la mayor estudia.

Luis Antonio  es agricultor y  siembra  maíz, frijol y maicillo Esta actividad tiene 16 años de desempeñarla, el trabajo lo aprendió solo porque desde pequeño le gusto la agricultura. 

Además trabaja como  jornalero de medio tiempo. Recorre aproximadamente  2 kilómetros  con su señora quien también lo ayuda con los cultivos ambos dedican diariamente 7 horas al trabajo de la tierra.


El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de  abono para fertilizar  el maíz sembrado. Mejorará  la producción agrícola la oportunidad  de cosechar mejor producto de maíz, la necesidad a satisfacer será la de abonar a tiempo la milpa en los días  justos cuando lo necesita el producto.

Luis tiene un sueño, es poner su propio negocio de venta de productos agrícolas  en los que pueda comercializar a todos los municipios cercanos.
Espera ver crecer a sus hijas y dejarlas con un titulo académico, además compra una vaca para aprovechar los residuos de las cosechas
texts.en:
Luis is 27 years old and has a 6th grade education. He has been living with his partner for six years and they have two daughters; one is three years old and the other is one year old. Only the older one is in school.

Luis Antonio is a farmer and he grows corn, beans and sorghum. He has been doing this for 16 years. He learned this work by himself because he was interested in agriculture as a child.  He also works as a part-time day laborer. He walks about two kilometers with his wife who also helps him with the crops. They both spend 7 hours every day working the land.

The loan will be used to buy manure to fertilize the corn they plant. Their goal is to be able to fertilize the cornfields at just the right time thereby improving the quantity and quality of the corn. 

Luis’s dream is to have his own business selling whatever crops he can to all the neighboring towns. He hopes to see his daughters grow up and graduate from school. He also wants to buy a cow to make use of the waste products from the harvests.

loans.use: to buy manure for established crops.

loans.name: Otilia Del Carmen

texts.es: Otilia, con 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, vive con su madre y sus hermanos. Trabaja los fines de semana en una truchera del corregimiento donde reside y para complementar sus ingresos, produce y vende comidas en la empresa donde labora, aprovechando que tiene el permiso para hacerlo. La cliente es una persona amable, humilde y luchadora; se esmera por sacar adelante a sus hijos, quienes son su principal motivación. Solicita el crédito con el interés de invertirlo en la compra de insumos para elaborar los alimentos (carne, verduras, salsas, entre otros) de esta manera tendrá insumos disponibles para preparar los alimentos y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes en los días que no son quincena, pues muchas veces ha perdido ventas por no tener la posibilidad de abrir créditos debido a que no cuenta con el capital disponible para surtirse diariamente. Otilia sueña con seguir avanzando y luchar con dedicación y esfuerzo para lograr tener un puesto de comidas fijo a las afueras de la truchera, para así tener ingresos a diario y poder continuar solventando las necesidades básicas de su familia y velar por el bienestar y la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Otilia, 39, is a single mother of two children.  She lives with her mother and her siblings.  She works weekends for a trout farm belonging to the small town she lives in and to add to her income produces meals to sell in the firm where she works taking advantage of having permission to do so.

She’s a kind, humble, hardworking person who strives to move her children forward; they are her main motivation.  She’s asking for the loan aiming at using it to buy ingredients to prepare her dishes (meat, vegetables and sauces, among others).  In this way, she’ll have the supplies on hand to prepare the meals and satisfy customer demand on days between payday because she’s often lost sales because she was unable to extend credit because she lacked enough capital to stock up on supplies daily.

Otilia dreams with continuing to make progress and to strive with dedication and effort to have a food stand outside the trout farm to earn daily income and be able to continue meeting basic family needs and to see to her children’s well-being and their education.

loans.use: to buy food making ingredients.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés, de 54 años, es una mujer alegre, amable y muy emprendedora, es madre de siete hijos de los cuales solo vive con dos de ellos en su casa propia. Inés se dedica a la agricultura, comienza sus labores muy temprano ya que debe cultivar, regar y preparar la tierra para sus sembríos, lleva en está actividad más de 23 años aproximadamente, ella aprendió a hacer este trabajo desde muy joven ya que sus padres tambien se dedicarón a este negocio. Le gusta su trabajo ya que tiene tiempo y puede compartirlo con sus hijos, tiene buenas ventas ya que los productos que le dan sus tierras son muy buenos, ella envía sus productos a la ciudad de Lima donde su hijo se encarga de venderlos, espera poder mantenerse así y más adelante poder empezar con otro tipo de sembríos. Este su sexto crédito con Kiva, por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por su parte se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de S/.3000 soles, comprará abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Inés, 54, is a cheerful, kind, very enterprising woman.  She’s mother of seven children only two of which still live at home with her.  She works in agriculture starting her tasks very early because she must till, water and prepare the soil for planting.  She’s been in this activity for about 23 years having learned it while very young from her parents who were also in this business.

She likes her work because she has time and can share it with her children.  Her sales are good because the products her land provides are very good.  She sends them to the city of Lima where her son takes care of selling them.  She hopes to remain this way and later on be able to start a new type of crop.

This is her 6th Kiva loan and she’s asking for your collaboration so that she can make her plans happen.  On her part, she commits to be punctual with her payments.  She will use the 3,000 soles to buy organic manure for her crop.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Charles

texts.es: Charles, de 32 años está casado con Beydi y tiene una niña de 05 años con quien vive en su casa propia. Durante su vida Charles realizó múltiples trabajos, pero el que mas le lleno de satisfacciones es el de la reforestación, esto debido a que es un amante de la naturaleza y tiene como fin ayudar a que en la zona aun se mantenga viva la naturaleza, a diario realiza reforestación de plantas y árboles de todo tipo de especie en los diferentes terrenos que solicitan de su trabajo. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 02 años y se siente muy contento de contribuir con un granito de arena a la conservación del medio ambiente. Le está yendo bien, ya que gracias a su trabajo a sensibilizado a gran parte de la población quienes atienden y entienden sus charlas que es de mucha importancia contribuir a la conservación del medio ambiente. Este es su sexto crédito con Kiva, por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Ya que se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de S/.2000 soles, comprará materiales que necesita para continuar con su trabajo, además de abono orgánico y algunas plantas que necesita para seguir brindando sus servicios.
texts.en:
Charles, 32 years old, is married to Beydi and has a 5 year old daughter. They live in a house they own. During his life Charles has had multiple jobs, however the one that gave him the most satisfaction was in reforestation, since he is nature lover and wants to help conserve nature. Every day he does plant and tree reforestation working with all kinds of species in different terrains where his work is requested. He has had this business for more than two years and is very pleased to contribute even one grain of sand to the conservation of the environment.

He is doing well since, thanks to his work he has sensitized a large part of the population who attend and understand his talks which are a very important contribution to environmental conservation. 

This is his sixth loan from Kiva. He is requesting your collaboration so that he can finalize his plans and feel sure of advancing his business. He is committed to making his payments on time. With the sum of S/. 2,000 requested, he will purchase the materials he needs to continue with his work, as well as organic compost and some plants that he needs to continue offering his services.

loans.use: to purchase materials, organic compost and plants to sow.

loans.name: Balentina

texts.es: La Sra. Balentina sigue con la misma actividad de la Venta de comida, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra  de un Frizer para mantener sus vegetales y carne conservados para su  para así elaborar sus platillos y también en la compra de un televisor para su negocio,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas,  se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Balentina continues with the same business: selling food.  She relates that she did well with the previous loan since she used it to buy a freezer to properly store the  vegetables and meat she uses to prepare her dishes.  She also bought a television set for her business.

On this occasion she’s asking for the loan to buy ingredients to prepare her meals.  She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity she’s being given to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy food-making supplies.

loans.name: María Bárbara

texts.es: María se dedica a la industria maquilera haciendo ropa para niños, ella vive junto a su compañero de vida. Ella solicita un préstamo  a FUSAI, para poder poner cemento y ladrillos en un pasillo de su casa el cual actualmente es de tierra, lo cual lo hace bastante incómodo para transitar en el, es por esto que María desea mejorar las condiciones de este.
texts.en: María works in an assembly plant that manufactures children’s clothes.  She lives with her life companion.   She’s asking FUSAI for a loan to install a cement and brick floor in her house’s hallway which is currently dirt and quite uncomfortable to walk through; this is why María wants to improve its condition.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks.

loans.name: Kivilu

texts.en:
Kivilu is a married, 34-year-old mother of seven living in Matuu. Kivilu has been running a food stall business for the past eight years with a monthly income of KES 26,520 which she uses to support her family. Kivilu is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. after she was introduced by an existing KADET client. 

She will use the loan to purchase wheat flour, kales, cereals, onions and cabbages in bulk for her food stall. She will plough back (reinvest) the proceeds into the business and invest the rest in opening a bigger hotel (restaurant). 

She hopes to be financially stable and a very happy family.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, kales, cereals, onions and cabbages in bulk for her food stall.

loans.name: José Roberto

texts.es: José es un joven trabajador quien se dedica a la industria de zapatos, debido a que las láminas de su techo están picadas y tienen muchas goteras, José solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para poder contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de dos docenas de láminas galvanizadas, así mismo para poder cambiar las puertas de su casa. De este modo él podrá mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.
texts.en: José’s a young worker who works in the shoe industry.  The metal sheets on his roof are full of holes so there are many leaks.  José is asking FUSAI for a loan to have the necessary money to buy two dozen galvanized metal sheets and also to replace the doors at home.  In this way he will be able to improve his home’s condition.

loans.use: to buy two dozen metal sheets.

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es: José es soltero y vive junto a su madre y una pequeña sobrina, él desea mucho poder mejorar las condiciones de su hogar, por lo que solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, con el cual cuente con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de láminas galvanizadas y cambiar el techo actual que está muy deteriorado, así mismo para poner techo en la cocina ya que actualmente no tiene y también encementar la misma área.
texts.en: José is single living with his mother a young niece.  He knows much about making home repairs which is why he’s asking FUSAI for a loan to have the money needed to buy galvanized metal sheets to replace the roof which is quite damaged.  He will also install a roof on the kitchen which currently has none and he will also enlarge it.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a 24-year-old hardworking woman with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells fresh foods and with the proceeds she has been able to provide the basics for herself and her child. Lack of preserving equipment and inadequate capital are her major challenges while her dreams are to buy land, grow bananas and own a supermarket. Harriet intends to use the loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Margarita Concepción

texts.es: Margarita de 52 años de edad, vive junto a su pequeño hijo de diez años de edad, por quien se esfuerza a diario para salir adelante. Ella trabaja realizando oficios domésticos con una familia de otra localidad y quienes la aprecian mucho.  Margarita solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, con el cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para realizar un muro de contención en su casa, el cual la proteja de diferentes factores como el clima y el exterior. Con esto ella y su hijo podrán vivir más seguros y mayor tranquilidad.
texts.en: Margarita, 52, lives with her 10-year-old son, for whom she works to move forward every day. She works by performing domestic tasks for a family in another community. They appreciate her very much. Margarita is requesting a FUSAI loan to get the money necessary to build a retaining wall for her house. This will protect her from different factors such as the temperature and the outdoors. With this loan, she and her son hope to live more safely and peacefully.

loans.use: to build a retaining wall

loans.name: San Antoniense Group

texts.es:
La señora Inecia es madre soltera. Tiene 31 años de edad. Cursó 5 años de educación primaria. Tiene 6 hijos y de ellos 4 estan estudiando. Se dedica a la confección de pants y sudaderos. Inició este negocio trabajando como operario y a la fecha lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de una máquina plana que le servirá para producir mas prendas de vestir. En el futuro desea contar con máquinas industriales y vender por mayor.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la confección de prendas de vestir y a actividades pecuarias.
texts.en:
Inecia is a single mother. She is 31 years old. She has 5 years of primary education. She has 6 children, and 4 of them are students. She makes pants and sweaters. She started this business working as a machine operator and today she has 6 years of experience.

She is organizing a group and requesting a loan that she will use to buy a tabletop sewing machine that will help her make more clothing. In the future, she wants to have industrial machines and sell wholesale.

The other members of the group make clothing and raise livestock.

loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a single man who is very hardworking and enterprising.

For the past one year, he has operated a clothes shop business, selling clothes for both men and women. He cites stiff competition as his major challenge. 

Peter is requesting KES 20,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Darlin Adilia

texts.es: Darlin vive junto a su esposo e hijos por quienes trabaja muy duro para salir adelante y contar con todo lo necesario. Ella solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para poder cambiar el techo de su casa y así comprar láminas galvanizadas para cambiarlas, también para reparar la pila de su casa ya que el agua se filtra y se desperdicia, lo cual no puede permitir ya que el agua escasea en ese lugar.
texts.en: Darlin lives with her husband and children for whom she works very hard in order to get ahead and have everything needed.  She’s asking FUSAI for a loan to replace the roof at home.  She will buy galvanized sheets to replace them and she will also repair the water tank at home because the water filters out and is wasted and she can’t let that continue because water is scarce there.

loans.use: to re-roof her house.

loans.name: Tomás De Jesús

texts.es: Tomás es soltero y vive junto a su familia, él trabaja como operario de máquinas y es muy responsable. Tomás solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para poder invertir en la compra de pintura y pintar su casa, así mismo actualmente él solo cuenta con puertas en la entrada de su casa por lo que desea colocar en las habitaciones y el baño y de este modo poder contar con mayor privacidad.
texts.en: Tomás is single living with his family.  He’s employed as a machine operator and is very responsible.  He’s asking FUSAI for a loan to buy paint to paint his house.  Also, he currently only has doors in the entrance to the house and he’d like to install them in the bedrooms and bathroom to have more privacy.

loans.use: to buy doors and paint.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Blanca vive junto a su familia, por quien trabaja muy duro para contar con una vida mejor. Ella solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para poder contar con el dinero necesario para la contratación de luz eléctrica en su casa, así mismo para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción y poder hacer de cemento un pasillo de su casa, trabajo el cual hasta ahora se le había hecho imposible realizar.
texts.en: Blanca lives with her family. She works very hard so they can have a better life. She is requesting a FUSAI loan to get the money she needs to get electricity in her house. She will also invest in buying construction materials to put in a cement path to her house, which had been impossible for her to complete until now.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mairon Antonio

texts.es: Mairon es una persona trabajadora y de buenas referencias, quien vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Él solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para poder pintar su vivienda, poder contratar el servicio de luz eléctrica y también terminar de pagar la instalación de agua potable en su casa. Esto será de gran beneficio para él y toda su familia ya que contarán con una mejor forma de vida.
texts.en: Mairon is a hard-working person with good references. He lives with his life partner and their children. He is requesting a FUSAI loan to be able to paint his house and get electricity. He will also finish paying for the installation of drinking water in his house. This will be a great benefit for him and his family because they will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to get electricity and paint for his house.

loans.name: Ground-Nut Sellers Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Ground-nut Sellers” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Ibrahim is the featured leader of this group. Ibrahim is 37 years old and married with three children who are attending primary school. Ibrahim sells cassava, potatoes, groundnuts, etc. With the help of this loan, Ibrahim will invest in his business by buying a large quantities of cassava, potatoes, groundnuts, etc. to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantities of cassava, potatoes, groundnuts, etc. to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Obed

texts.es: Obed, vive junto a su esposa e hijos, él es un padre de familia responsable y trabajador quien siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante. Debido a que Obed reside en una zona rural, no cuentan con luz eléctrica, por lo que él solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para poder invertir en la contratación de luz eléctrica en su casa, lo cual será de mucho beneficio para toda la familia, ya que podrá realizar todas las actividades como hacer tareas incluso por las noches.
texts.en: Obed lives with his wife and children. He is a responsible and hard-working family man who always makes an effort to move ahead. Since Obed lives in a rural area, he does not have electric light, so he is asking for a loan from FUSAI in order to be able to sign up for electric light in his house, which will be of great benefit to the whole family, since they will be able to do all of their activities such as homework even at night.

loans.use: to sign up for electric light

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: El Sr. Gilberto se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace ya varios años aprendió el oficio de confección de su padre quien también trabaja en la misma actividad,  el confecciona chamarras y ropa  deportiva, tiene su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que es en la en la localidad de Huarina,  Este préstamo es su  Primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Gilberto va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas para la confección de prendas de vestir por mayor, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión,  el Sr. Gilberto enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes. Ya que esta época tiene mucha demanda, el Sr. Gilberto es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Gilberto has worked for several years as a tailor making outfits. He learned this skill from his father, who also works in this job. He makes jackets and sports clothes. He has a workshop in the same place he lives, which is in Huarina. This is his first loan with this institution. Gilberto will use this loan to buy wholesale fabric for making clothes.

He is requesting this loan to increase his investment capital. Gilberto faces challenges in his business, which include increasing his income. He will use the investment to buy high quality tailoring materials so he can have more customers. At this time, there is a high demand. Gilberto is a hard-working and happy person. He is happy and grateful to the institution for giving him support because this is his only form of income.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making clothes.

loans.name: Antonia Patricia

texts.es: Antonia vive junto a sus tres hijos, su compañero de vida reside fuera del país y le brinda una pequeña ayuda cada mes. Antonia solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, ya que el piso de su casa es de cemento y en una habitación se ha ido deteriorando con el tiempo, por lo que desea repararlo. Con este préstamo ella comprará el cemento y arena necesaria para realizar esta mejora. Su compañero de vida hará un mayor esfuerzo para apoyarla y solventar juntos esta deuda.
texts.en: Antonia lives with her three children. Her life partner lives out of the country and helps support them every month. Antonia is requesting a FUSAI loan because the floor in her house is cement and in one room, it has been deteriorating and she wants to repair it. With this loan, she will buy the cement and sand she needs to make this improvement. Her life partner will make a bigger effort to support her and they will pay off this loan together.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to repair the floor in one room.

loans.name: Group 7 At Lien Mac 1

texts.en: Toan, pictured fifth from the left, makes about $37 (800,000 VND) every month working in the rice paddies.  She is 49 years old and has two grown children.  She has not been able to install a hygienic toilet at home.  However, as a member of the local Women's Union since 1993, she recently joined a campaign to improve the community's sanitation and hygiene.  With this loan, she and seven of her peers will each build a hygienic toilet at home that will improve their family's and the community's quality of life.  With eight households making a commitment, this neighborhood will be able to enjoy better health by avoiding many of the common infections and diseases associated with the unsafe latrines currently being used.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet

loans.name: Group 8 At Lien Mac 1

texts.en: Cuc, second from the left, works in the rice paddies where she makes about $33 (700,000 VND) a month.  She is 33 years old and has two children: one young child at home and another in high school.  Currently, her family does not have a sanitary toilet at home.  She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2001 and is involved in a campaign to improve local sanitation and hygiene.  Members of the Women's Union decided that it is not enough for one family at a time to upgrade their facilities, but the entire neighborhood must be involved and committed.  With this loan, Cuc and eight of her peers will each install a sanitary household toilet to improve the quality of life for all of their family members.  These sanitary toilets will help their families reduce the risk of infection and diseases associated with the latrines currently being used. *Please note: the person on the far left is not a borrower, but a local community member.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet

loans.name: Angelina Beatriz

texts.es: Angelina vive junto a tres hijos menores de edad, ella es madre soltera y trabaja muy duro para salir adelante. Angelina solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, por medio del cual pueda comprar láminas para construir un pequeño pasillo o corredor en su casa y así mismo desea construir un baño sanitario. De este modo ella y sus hijos podrán salir al baño sin mojarse cuando llueva ya que contaran con un pasillo de láminas que los proteja de la lluvia.
texts.en: Angelina lives with her three children, all minors. She is a single mother who works very hard to move forward. Angelina is requesting a FUSAI loan to buy laminate so she can build a small hallway in her house. She also wants to build a bathroom. This will allow her and her children to go to the bathroom without getting wet when it rains. Therefore, a laminate hallway would protect them from the rain.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and hallway in her house; and to buy laminate, nails, and wood.

loans.name: Claudia Lisette

texts.es: Claudia vive junto a su única hija, ella es madre soltera y es muy responsable y trabajadora, ya que vela por el bienestar de su pequeña. Claudia solicita un préstamo a FUSAI por medio del cual pueda mejorar el piso de su casa, ya que la mitad es de cemento y la otra mitad de tierra, por lo que ella desea poder encementar el área actual que tiene piso de tierra y solucionar el problema de polvo e higiene dentro de su casa.
texts.en:
Claudia lives with her only daughter. She is a single mom who is very responsible, hard working and looks out for the welfare of her little one. 

Claudia is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to improve the floor in her house. 

Half of it is cement and the other half is dirt. 

She wants to fill in the dirt side with cement and solve the problem of dust and hygiene inside the house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel etc. to fix her floor.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es:
Doña María Ester tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos los cuales contribuyen al desarrollo de las diferentes actividades que en el campo se elaboran como ser: limpieza, aplicación de abono, fertilizantes, fungicidas, etc. que ayudan al buen mantenimiento y protección de sus productos. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo el cual curso con mucho esfuerzo y apoyo por parte de sus padres a pesar de las pocas opciones que en su juventud había en la zona donde ella habita. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en dichas actividades ya que fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra y en compañía de su pareja lo practica hace más de 9 años. El terreno que ellos en familia trabajan es propio gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres el cual está ubicado a 40 minutos de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se traslada a pie.

Sus metas son las de poder comprar otro terreno en donde ella pueda cultivar otra variedad de café mucho más atractiva para poder ofrecer a sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos, de esa manera ella podrá fortalecer el patrimonio familiar para sus hijos. Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita un financiamiento para comprar insumos agrícolas para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café como también nueva chapola para poder cultivar.
texts.en:
María Ester is 43, married has 4 children that contribute to the different activities done in the field such as: cleaning, fertilizer application, fungicide application, etc., that help to the good maintenance and protection of her products.  She has a level of elementary education complete, which she studied with much effort and support from her parents, in spite of the little options that existed in the area where she lived when she was young.  She has a lot of experience in farming activities because it was her parents who taught her how to work the land and together with her partner she has worked on this for more than nine years.  The land that they work as a family is owned thanks to an inheritance from her parents and it's located 40 minutes away from her residence, where she walks from.

Her goals are to be able to buy another piece of land where she can grow a different coffee variety that is more attractive to be able to offer it to her customers and generate more income, this way she can strengthen the  family patrimony for her children.  This is why today she requests financing to buy agricultural inputs for maintenance of her coffee crops and to buy "chapola" (coffee plants) to plant the new crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for maintenance of her coffee crops and to buy "chapola" (coffee plants) to plant the new crops.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de 42 años de edad, vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, tanto ella como su compañero trabajan muy duro para sostener su hogar. Margarita además de dedicarse a elaborar alguna comida típica como pasteles (de masa de maíz relleno de verduras con carne) que los comercializa en su localidad, trabaja lavando ropa ajena dos días a la semana en otra ciudad del país. Margarita solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, con el cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de puertas para su casa y así mismo para poner balcones en las ventanas, ya que actualmente no tiene. Con esto Margarita podrá contar con una mayor seguridad en su casa.
texts.en:
Margarita, 42, lives with her life partner and their two children. 

They both work very hard to maintain their home. Margarita earns money by making typical food such as pastries (of corn dough filled with vegetables and meat) which she sells out of her house. She also washes clothes two days a week in another city.

Margarita is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in buying doors for her house as well as window railings which she currently does not have. 

With this Margarita will have a safer home.

loans.use: to buy doors and window railings for her home.

loans.name: María Milagro

texts.es: María es una señora muy responsable y cuidados de su hogar, ella vive junto a su esposo con quien desean mucho contar con una casa en excelentes condiciones. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el monto necesario para comprar láminas galvanizadas y así poder reparar el techo actual debido a que necesita ser cambiado ya que el actual esta picado y el sol y la lluvia penetran a la casa, además de reparar una filtración de agua que tiene entre la pared y la lamina existente.
texts.en: Maria is very responsible and takes care of her home, she lives with her husband and together they really wish to have a house in excellent conditions.  Maria requests a loan to be able to have the necessary amount to buy galvanized metal sheets and this way be able to repair the current roof, as it needs to be changed because the current one is damaged and sun and rain get through her home, she also wants to fix the water drainage between the wall and the existing metal.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets to repair a water leak in the roof.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: El Sr.  Gilberto   de  32   años de edad es casado y tiene tres  personas que dependen económicamente de él.  el Sr   trabaja en una empresa  de la localidad    desempeñándose como  soldador  puesto que se ha ganado a base de esfuerzo,  es un hombre de familia siempre buscando y procurando lo mejor para sus hijos. En esta ocasión   está  solicitando un crédito  para poder  impermeabilizar  y  poner piso firme en el patio exterior de su domicilio  ,  El sabe que su familia  se merece  lo mejor es por eso que ha tratado siempre de brindarles lo que ellos necesitan y  ofrecerles  la mejor comodidad,   El agradecerá el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Gilberto, 32, is married and has three people who are economically dependent on him. 

He works for a local company as a welder, a position he has earned through a lot of effort. He is a family man who is always looking for the best for his children. 

At this time he is asking for a loan so he can waterproof and put flooring on the outside patio of his house. 

He knows his family deserves the best, this is why he has always tried to give them what they need and keep them comfortable. 

He appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy waterproofing, cement, sand

loans.name: Daniel Rodrigo

texts.es: El señor Daniel, es una persona de 31 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, alcanzo a estudiar una carrera universitaria es Ingeniero Comercial y no cuenta con dependientes económicos a cargo. El señor Daniel vive en su propio domicilio el cual se halla situado en la ciudad de Cochabamba; asimismo mencionar que la actividad económica del señor Daniel es prestar servicios en una empresa de seguros. Finalmente el señor Daniel manifiesta ser una persona responsable que quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el credito para refaccionar parte de su vivienda que se vio afectada con el paso de los años.
texts.en:
Daniel, 31, is single and succeeded in completing his Commercial Engineering university career.  He has no economic dependents in his care.  

Daniel lives in his own address located in the city of Cochabamba and his economic activity is providing services in an insurance company.  Daniel states that he’s a responsible person who wants to improve his quality of life and this is why he’s asking for a loan in order to repair part of his house that’s been damaged over time.

loans.use: to repair some cracked walls in his house

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña Guapa quiere decir mujer laboriosa, y es justamente lo que son estas mujeres, integrantes de este grupo, ellas estan en su segundo ciclo del programa de comité, ademas todas estan haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para que de esa forma conozcan la situación que cada una tiene.
Silvina es la presidenta de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas,además de su trabajo independiente, comenta que también es la presidenta del grupo, el cual es un cargo muy importante. Ella pone todo de si para poder ir mejorando cada día. Solicita de este crédito para que pueda comprar prendas de verano, ya que se acerca la epoca de calor, y quiere poder tener una buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
"Kuña Guapa" means "hardworking woman", and that is just what these women who are members of this group are. They are in their second cycle of the committee program. Also, all of them are participating in the poverty elimination survey, so that each of their situations can be known.

Silvina is the president of this group. She sells clothes. In addition to working on her own, she is the president of the group, which is a very important position. She gives everything of herself to be able to improve every day. She is asking for this loan to be bale to buy summer clothing, since the warm weather is coming. She wants to be able to have a good variety to offer her customers. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting and it will be a big help.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mirna Guadalupe

texts.es: Mirna es una mujer muy responsable y dedicada al bienestar de su hogar, vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja muy duro para salir adelante. Mirna solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, ya que por el pasar del tiempo, su techo se ha deteriorado, teniendo mucho moho y agujeros por donde se filtra el agua. Con este préstamo Mirna podrá comprar láminas galvanizadas nuevas y sustituirlas por las existentes, lo que le permita tener su casa en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Mirna is a very responsible woman who is dedicated to the well being of her home. She lives with her husband who works very hard to get ahead. 

Mirna is requesting a loan from FUSAI because time has passed and her roof has deteriorated. It has a lot of mold and holes where water leaks through. 

With this loan Mirna will be able to buy new galvanized sheets and replace the existing ones. This will help her improve the condition of her home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets to fix the roof in her home.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo San cayetano pese a las dificultades esta saliendo adelante, son 15 mujeres muy trabajadores, que se unieron con el proposito de poder ayudarse y poder mejorar por medio del esfuerzo de todas. Mercedes es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la costura.
Ella es una persona que se destaca con su clientela ya que siempre hace trabajos muy buenos y con ello esta saliendo adelante. Quiere seguir invirtiendo en su trabajo, y es por eso que pide de este crédito, ya que quiere comprar telas, hilos, gomas y demás, y asi poder cumplir con pedidos que tiene y también seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano group is making progress in spite of the difficulties. They are 15 very hard working women, who got together with the idea of being able to help themselves and being able to improve by means of their joint effort.

Mercedes is one of the members, who makes a living from sewing. For her customers she stands out because she always does very good work and by doing this she is getting on in life. She wants to continue investing in her work and this is why she is asking for this loan, since she wants to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other items so she can fulfil the orders she has and also carry on working.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other items.

loans.name: Marcello

texts.es: El joven Marcello tiene 18 años de edad. Es originario de la ciudad de Diriamba, soltero, estudiante universitario de la carrera ingeniería ambiental. Eligio esta profesión, ya que al ver la situación que se encuentra Nicaragua, le gustaría contribuir  a plantear energía renovable y nuevas técnicas de producción que no afecten al medio ambiente. Cuenta con el apoyo económico de sus padres, quienes se dedican a brindar el servicio de hotel de playa y a realizar proyectos de turismo y desarrollo en el país. Solicita este crédito para completar pagos de mensualidad, alojamiento y alimentación, ya que recibió una beca de excelencia académica en el extranjero. Estima que el crédito lo necesita para completar los requisitos de la universidad y lograr culminar sus estudios con éxito. Una vez terminada su carrera implementara o realizara proyectos los cuales seran de beneficio para el ambiente. A medida que conozca y adquiera experiencia en su carrera, desea especializarse en áreas ligadas a su profesión y sacar una maestría en administración. Es un joven con muchos deseos de superación y de preocupación hacia el desarrollo ambiental.
texts.en:
Marcello is a young man who is 18 years of age.  He is single and originally from the city of Diriamba.  Marcello is a university student who is studying Environmental Engineering.  He chose this profession because of the current situation as he sees it in Nicaragua.  Marcello would like to contribute to raising awareness of renewable energy and new production techniques that do not harm the environment.  He has the financial support of his parents, who provide hotel services along the beach and undertake tourism and development projects throughout the country.  

Marcello is requesting this loan so that he can complete his monthly payments for tuition, room, and board.  He has already received a foreign scholarship for academic excellence.  Marcello says that he needs the loan to complete his university requirements so that he can successfully complete his studies.  Once he finishes his degree, he plans to pursue and engage in projects that will be beneficial to the environment.  With the knowledge and experience he gains with his degree, he wants to specialize in areas that are related to his profession.  Therefore, he would like to study for a Masters degree in Management.  Marcello is a young man who has tremendous drive to succeed and a deep concern for environmental development.

loans.use: to submit his monthly payments for tuition, room, and board.

loans.name: Los Amigasos Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LOS AMIGASOS está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Cinthia, tiene 19 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada,  ella vende sus productos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Cinthia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa de temporada al por mayor ya que se acerca la época de calor, y esta época tiene mucha venta e incluso pedidos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra. Cinthia  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar electrodomésticos para su casa, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra. Cinthia se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le permite mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Los Amigasos” consists of eight members, seven women and one man.  The president of this Communal Bank is Sra. Cinthia.  She is 19 years old and sells clothes based on the season.  Cinthia sells her products from a vending post in the town of El Torno.  This loan is her first cycle with Emprender.  

Sra. Cinthia will use this loan to buy seasonal clothing in bulk since the warm season is approaching.  During this time, she generates many sales and receives numerous orders.  Her reason for requesting this loan is that she lacks capital.  Sra. Cinthia faces challenges in her business, such as dealing with the daily competition.  She plans to use her profits to buy appliances for her home.  Her wish for her business is to be stocked with more merchandise so that she can offer a variety of products to her customers.  

Sra. Cinthia is pleased and appreciative of Emprender for the support it has provided since it will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel de 28 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a la situación económica en que vivían sus padres, actualmente está acompañado, y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos además tiene un pequeño negocio de pupusas; han procreado dos hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad, se encuentran estudiando 6° y 2° grado. En la casa vive la madre de su pareja que le ayuda a cuidar a los hijos cuando ellos están trabajando.

Él es agricultor desde que tiene uso de la razón, manifiesta que su padre lo llevaba y su hermano a trabajar, desde pequeño y fue así que se acostumbró y aprendiendo el  trabajo de la siembra de maíz. Para llegar al terreno donde siembra, camina aproximadamente 15 minutos, y con su hermano que vive en otra vivienda hacen todas las labores desde la siembra hasta la cosecha, el horario de trabajo es variado se va muy temprano y regresa a las casa para almorzar y regresa a las 2 nuevamente a seguir trabajando.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar herbicidas y abonos; ya que siembran 17, 500 metros cuadrados de maíz. La inversión les ayudara  para combatir las plagas y enfermedades del cultivo para incrementar su producción.

Sueña que el negocio de su pareja crezca y el sacar buenas ganancias con la venta de maíz, para seguir dándoles estudios a sus hijos y que puedan ser algún día profesionales. Las ganancias las piensa invertir en el negocio de su pareja, en la compra de mesas, sillas y utensilios de cocina, y dejar un poco de dinero para la nueva siembra.
texts.en:
Daniel is a 41-year-old man. He did not have the opportunity to study because of his parents' economic situation. His partner takes care of the household duties and has a small pupusa business. They have two children,  11 and 7 years old, who are in the sixth and second grades. His partner's mother lives in the house and helps them take care of the children when the two of them are working.

He has been farming ever since he was a child. He says that his father took him and his brother to work when they were little, so he got used to it and learned how to cultivate corn. It takes him about 15 minutes to walk to his fields. He and his brother, who lives in another house, do all the work from planting to harvest. Their work schedule is varied. He goes out very early and returns home for lunch, and then goes back out again at 2 to continue working.


He is requesting this loan to buy herbicides and fertilizers for their 17,500 square meters of corn. The investment will help them combat pests and diseases in their crop and increase their yield.

He dreams that his partner's business will grow and that he will make a good income selling corn so that he can pay for his children's schooling and they can have good careers one day. He plans to use his profits to invest in his partner's business, to buy tables, chairs, and kitchen tools, and to leave a little money for the next planting.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and fertilizer for his 17,500 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Silvia Guadalupe

texts.es: Silvia vive junto a su compañero de vida e hijos. Ella trabaja como empleada doméstica. Silvia solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para contar con el dinero necesario para comprar materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento, ladrillos y otros más para mandar a hacer una pila grande con un lavadero que le permita almacenar más agua, debido a que muchas ocasiones escasea el servicio de agua potable en la zona, y al tener construida su pila grande espera que con esto podrá contar con más agua y realizar las actividades normales del hogar.
texts.en: Silvia lives with her life partner and children. She works as a domestic employee. Silvia is requesting a FUSAI loan to get the money she needs to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, bricks, and other supplies to have a large basin with a washing area built, which will allow her to store more water. She needs this because she is often lacking drinking water in her area and by building a large basin, she hopes to have more water so she can complete household chores.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and other supplies to make a basin to store water.

loans.name: Angie Andrea

texts.es: Angie con 19 años de edad, vive con sus padres y se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que inició como una opción para generar ingresos y poder aportar a la economía de su hogar. Es una joven inteligente, activa y emprendedora, se proyecta hacia el cumplimiento de sus metas y por esta razón desea capacitarse, por lo que solicita el crédito para financiar un curso de capacitación sobre coctelería y pasabocas, pues además de ser un tema que le gusta, sabe que sería un buen proyecto de negocio. Angie desea seguir capacitándose en diversos temas y además quiere seguir trabajando de manera independiente, pues sueña con agrandar su negocio actual de venta de ropa y en un futuro quiere adquirir un local comercial para continuar con su actividad y así brindar a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Angie,19, lives with her parents and sells clothes. A business she started as an option to generate income and support the household economy. 

She is an intelligent, active and enterprising person. She works hard to accomplish her goals and for this reason wants to take classes. 

She is requesting a loan to finance a training course in cocktails and snacks. 

Apart from being something she is interested in, she knows it would be a good business project. 

Angie wants to keep learning different subjects and she wants to keep working independently. 

She dreams of expanding her current clothes selling business and in the future have a store and in this way give her parents a better quality of life and well being.

loans.use: to pay for a cocktail and snack training course.

loans.name: Dúo Raquel De San Pedro Group

texts.es:
DUO RAQUEL DE SAN PEDRO
Este dúo está formado por Raquel, ella tiene 20 años de edad y es muy trabajadora.  Ella tiene una tortillería desde hace un año y necesita el  préstamo para comprar maíz por quintal, ya que de esa forma ella puede comprar más barato el maíz si compra varios quintales.   Su sueño  es ir mejorando en el negocio y poder  ayudar a sus papás a construir una casa más grande porque la que tienen es muy pequeña y tener mejores condiciones de vida, sus clientes ya la conocen y su tortillería está en un buen punto donde le compran bastante, Su compañera la señora María Margarita también tiene una tortillería y el crédito que solicita es para invertir en la compra de maíz por quintal, sueño es poder darles educación a sus hijos y que ellos tengan mejores oportunidades que ella, ella lucha para que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
RAQUEL DE SAN PEDRO DUO

This duo is formed by Raquel. She is 20 years old and is a very hard-working woman. She has had a tortilla business for a year and she needs the loan to buy corn by the quintal, as she is able to buy corn cheaper this way if she buys multiple quintales. Her dream is to improve her business, to be able to help her parents build a larger house because the one they have is very small, and to have better living conditions. Her customers know her already and her tortilla business is at a good point as she is selling quite a bit.

Her partner Maria Margarita also has a tortilla business, and the credit she is seeking is for buying corn by the quintal. Her dream is to be able to provide education for her children so that they will have better opportunities than her. She works hard so that her business continues growing.

loans.use: to buy corn for making and selling tortillas

loans.name: Fifonsi I Group

texts.fr: Le groupement FIFONSI I est composé de huit personnes qui habitent dans le même village. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Elise est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Elise a très peu fréquenté l’école. Elise est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un réceptionniste du nom de cyriaque. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Elise vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Elise vend depuis une quinzaine d'année, des beignets de blé et des articles de mercerie dans sa région. Afin de renforcer son activité et dans le but de faire face à sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Elise sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFONSI I. Ce crédit leur permettra surement de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Fifonsi I group is made up of eight people who live in the same village. This is the third time that the group has requested financing from ALIDé in order to raise the level of their business. 

The representative of the group, named Elise, has her hand raised in the photo. Elise received very little schooling.She is 43 years old and married to a receptionist named Cyriaque. The couple has four children, all of whom attend school and are in their care. Elise lives with her children. The various needs of the household are taken care of by the couple.

In order to provide for their needs, Elise has been selling wheat pastries and dry goods in her region for the last fifteen years. In order to bolster her business and with the goal of meeting the needs of her growing customer base, Elise is requesting a third loan from ALIDé together with the members of Fifonsi I. This credit will allow them to raise the level of their businesses and to make more profit. Their first two loans were fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase one bag of wheat flour, two cans of vegetable oil, and dry goods supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
In Mulundu village in Kenya, Beatrice has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. She is a friendly, hardworking, trustworthy, and well known member of the community with 4 children who are 22, 21, 14, and 9 years old. She lives in a house with mud walls, a concrete floor, and an iron roof house with her grandchild. Beatrice works as a maize and beans farmer and is an active member in her community, especially the women's group.

Mulundu village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Beatrice and the 25 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Beatrice has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. She volunteered to be the promoter to assist the community to grow and to help prevent water-borne diseases. Someone in Beatrice's family has suffered from water-borne diseases in the past and she wants to prevent this from happening again in the future. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Sheilah, Agnes, Elizabeth, and Angela.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Beatrice’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To support an innovative water treatment technology - chlorine dispensers.

loans.name: Ebby's Group

texts.en:
Ebby is 45 years old, has completed secondary school, and has 6 children.  She currently works has a maize farmer and is known in the community as being friendly and hardworking.  Ebby is also actively involved in her community, especially in the women's group.  

Ebby lives in Chebunayu village in Senende sub-location in Kenya. Chebunayu does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Ebby and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Ebby works as a subsistence farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. The chlorine dispenser will service 19 households in this community. Ebby and other promoters in her community need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Ebby will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed.  There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Jane, Nancy, Kepha, and Everlyn. Ebby wants to be a promoter because she is hardworking and she believes that the dispenser will benefit the community. She has family members who have been sick due to waterborne diseases and wants to prevent this from happening again in the future.  

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Ebby’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water.

loans.name: Sila's Group

texts.en:
Sila lives in a house made of mud walls, with dirt floors and an iron roof. He lives in Kamulukuywa village in Senende, Kenya with his wife, 5 children, and grandsons. Sila is 55 years old, has completed some primary school, and works as a maize farmer. Within the community, he is thought to be friendly, well-liked, and reliable.

The community of Kamulukuywa village collects their drinking water from a protected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Kamulukuywa’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Kamulukuywa, 30 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Sila has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter because he wants to serve his community. He will be responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Charles, Milkah, Julius, and Wilfred.

Kamulukuywa village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Sila believes that the dispenser will reduce sicknesses and will encourage a healthier lifestyle. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits.  Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Sila’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers.

loans.name: Maclellan's Group

texts.en:
Maclellan lives in a house with mud walls, with dirt floors and an iron roof. He lives in Jivuye A village in Muhundu, Kenya with his wife and 4 children (ages 12, 12, 8, and 4). Maclellan is 38, has completed secondary school, works as a farmer of maize and beans, and is known to be friendly.

The community of Jivuye A village collects their drinking water from a river because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Jivuye A’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Jivuye A, 11 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Maclellan has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Albert, Hellen, Rebeccah, and Agripinah.

Jivuye A village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser.  Maclellan believes that the dispenser will help to kill bugs in drinking water. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Maclellan’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To improve health and productivity by increasing access to safe drinking water through chlorine dispensers.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur  ADAMA  est âgé de 33 ans et vit avec ses deux enfants et son épouse dans une famille nucléaire à KANGARE, un des villages de la sous préfecture  SELINGUE, Région de SIKASSO.
Adama, très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales et autres article divers. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales et d’articles divers. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son troisième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 2 tonnes de riz, 5 sacs de sucre et quelques cartons de thé auprès des grossistes de BAMAKO qu’il revend en détail à KANGARE à crédit et au comptant à une clientèle mixte.
ADAMA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Adama is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a nuclear family in Kangare, one of the villages in the prefecture of the Selingue region of Sikasso. Adama became quickly interested in business, specifically in the purchase and sale of cereals and other various items. He learned this business from his maternal uncle, who was once a large shopkeeper of cereals and various items.

With the concern of satisfying his growing customer base, Adama decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his third individual loan which he will use to purchase 2 tons of rice, 5 bags of sugar, and several boxes of tea from wholesalers in Bamako which he will then resell at retail in Kangare for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. He hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA which he will use to repay the loan and reinvest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase various items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement and sand, for his house.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr:
Monsieur  MOHAMED  est âgé de 28 ans et vit avec son enfant et son épouse dans le quartier carrière de la commune de BAYA sous préfecture de SELINGUE, Région de SIKASSO.
MOHAMED n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des marchandises de boutique, riz et autres articles divers. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant d’article divers. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son quatrième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter d’article divers auprès des grossistes de BAMAKO qu’il revend en détail dans le quartier  et dans les villages environnants  à crédit et au comptant à une clientèle mixte.
MOHAMED espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 85.000. FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mohamed is 28 years old and lives with his child and his wife in the quarry neighborhood of the Baya community in the Selingue prefecture of the Sikasso region. He did not have the opportunity to attend school. He became interested in business early on, specifically in the purchase and sale of shop merchandise, rice, and other various items. He learned this business from his maternal uncle, who was once a large shopkeeper selling various items.

Due to the concern of satisfying his customers' growing needs, he decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his fourth individual loan which he will use to purchase various items from wholesalers in Bamako which he will then resell at retail in his neighborhood and surrounding villages, for cash and for credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. 

Mohamed hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 85,000 francs CFA, which he will use to repay the loan and to reinvest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: to purchase various items

loans.name: Félicienne's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Félicienne celle qui a la main levée sur la photo est la représentante du groupe. Félicienne est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur nommé Jean-Baptiste. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En dehors de ces trois enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à sa charge. Félicienne vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Félicienne et son mari assument ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour ce faire, Félicienne vend des sachets et des habits pour bébé de façon ambulante depuis dix ans. Félicienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du  Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de leur clientèle et pour accroître leur chiffre d’affaires Félicienne, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe, sollicite un premier crédit.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the first time that the group is requesting financing from ALIDé, in order to raise the level of thir business. Félicienne is the one pictured with her hand raised in the photo, and is the representative of the group. 

Félicienne is 36 years old and married to a chauffeur named Jean-Baptiste. The couple has three children, all of whom attend school and are in their care. Félicienne lives with her husband and their children. Together, she and her husband care for the household needs. 

In order to meet the needs of her family, Félicienne has been selling small bags and baby clothes from door to door for ten years. She stocks up at a market in Benin. In order to satisfy the needs of their customers and to increase their revenue, Félicienne, together with the other members of her group, are requesting their first loan.

loans.use: to purchase small bags and clothes

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is a single mother of six children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling smoked fish and has been in this business for ten years. 

She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baskets of fish.  She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of smoked fish.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 42 years old. She sells different items in her boutique. She has been running the business for the past seven years. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more cooking oil and sugar for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Tomasa de cincuenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo en casa propia.
