She stitches clothes with the latest designs and provides good service to her clients. She has attained a good number of customers. Currently, she has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons and lace. In this way, she will be able to meet with the increasing demand of her customers without delay. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons and lace.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is a 47-year-old married woman and has been running her business of stitching cloths for the past five years. She started her business on a small scale in her community to generate income to support her family, especially for the education of her children. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue the operations of her business, she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy stock of thread in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons to meet increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock of thread in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 41 years old and a married woman who has been running a small general store for a period of about three years to meet her family's expenses. She is a mother of six children and she is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing, and health. 

Shamim wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy packs of oil, biscuits, and beverages, to meet the increasing demand at her store. 

It's Shamim's second year with Kashf Foundation and she has shown good repayment behavior. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of oil, biscuits, and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 47 years old and married.  She operates her own business of cloth sales to support her husband financially in meeting their household expenses. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and sells them to the people in her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.  

Naseem is requesting a loan from Kashf Foundation for 25,000 PKR, which she will use to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Naseem expects a boost in her earnings with this loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 30 years old and married, the mother of seven children. Her husband's income is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of the Kashf Foundation, Sakina has gradually improved her business.  Currently she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo. 

This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en: Farhat is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making artificial jewelery for many years. The business has great potential for growth. Farhat is actively helping her husband financially, as this business is the only source of income for them. She has six children and is motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. In order to meet the orders on time and boost her sales, Farhat requested a loan of 15,000 PKR to purchase raw materials such as silver, gold, and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to increase her net income and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as silver, gold, and dozens of artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is 43 years old, married and the mother of six children. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failed, and decided to initiate her own business to support her family and give it a better future. Three years ago she opened a general store in a corner of her house. She has become famous for providing good-quality products to people in her area. However, due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for Rs 20,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of rice, flour and sugar. In this way she would be able to consistently meet this increasing demand. She is in her 8th loan cycle and has a good credit history. She wants to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy supplies of rice, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 24-year-old married man from Qalqilya city. He lives in a very old house where his family used to live. Ibrahim is a worker in a local aluminum factory in the city. He earns a low wage and it is the only source of income for the family. Ibrahim would like to improve his family's living conditions, but he does not have enough money.

Ibrahim took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to repair the family home, especially the paint and changing the doors. This will improve the family's living conditions. 

Ibrahim appears in the photo.

loans.use: to repair the family home, especially the paint and changing the doors

loans.name: Sayyohidin

texts.ru: Сайёхидин простой фермер. Он проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 31 год. Сайёхидин занимается растениеводством 17 лет. На своей земле он сажает лук и пшеницу. Ему помогает его жена, дети тоже хотят помочь отцу, но они маленькие. Сайёхидин отец четверых детей, а также он преподает в средней школе. Он с женой старательно готовится к осеннему посеву. И кредит берет для приобретения семян лука и пшеничных зерен. Сайёхидин настойчиво готовиться, и надеется, что в следующем году получит богатый урожай. Больше всего ему нравятся то что он получит честный заработок нажитым своими руками своим трудом. Сайёхидин жизнерадостный и честный человек. Надеемся, он воспитает своих детей такими же.
texts.en:
Sayyohidin is a simple farmer. He is 31 years old and lives in Shahrituz, Tajikistan. Sayyohidin has been growing crops since he was 17 years old. He plants onion and wheat on his land. His wife helps him, but his children, although they want to help, are too young. Sayohhidin has four children and teaches at a high school.

Sayyohidin and his wife are working hard to prepare for autumn planting. The loan will allow them to buy onion and wheat seeds. Sayyohidin is working diligently, and hopes that next year will bring a plentiful harvest. Most of all, he likes that he will earn his living honestly and through his own effort. Sayyohidin is a happy and honest person; we hope that he will raise his children to be the same way.

loans.use: to buy onion and wheat seed.

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is a 59-year-old married man from a small village near Jenin City. He is the father of a son and a daughter. Sameer works on a small bus where he transfers children from their kindergarten. Also, he buys some products like clothes and sells them to the local traders in the city. It is a profitable job but he needs some money to buy more products. 

Sameer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products, especially clothes, and resell them to the local traders. This loan will improve his business and also his income. 
Sameer appears in the photo in his store where he keeps the stocks

loans.use: to buy more products, especially clothes, and resell them to the local traders

loans.name: Ruth Noemi

texts.es:
La  señora Ruth de 56 años, vive con sus hijos  en su casa de habitación ubicada en un barrio de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 20 años a la elaboración y venta de vestidos, pantalones de mujer, pantalones de hombre, trajes de señora, etc. 
Doña Ruth su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación y sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que el visitan de diferentes barrios de donde vive, le prefieren por su buena atención y por su buen trabajo.
Doña Ruth está solicitando  el préstamo para compra de telas, hilos, agujas de máquina y adornos para sus diferentes diseños que hace en la sastrería, ya que tiene varios  encargos de vestidos que entregar y necesita variedad de telas. Está muy contenta de trabajar con Prisma ya que con la ayuda de los préstamos que se le han brindado a podido ampliar su negocio.
Doña Ruth su sueño ampliar su negocio.
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre  del 2013.
texts.en:
Ruth, 56, lives with her children in her house located in a neighborhood in San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.  For the last 20 years she’s worked making and selling dresses, women’s slacks, men’s trousers, women’s suits, etc.  Ruth’s business is located at home and her customers are neighbors and friends that visit her from the various neighborhoods they live in.  They prefer her because of the good service and her  good work.

Ruth is asking for the loan to buy fabric, thread, machine needles and decorations for her various designs since she does tailoring and has several dresses on order she needs to deliver; she needs a variety of fabrics.  

She’s very happy to work with Prisma because she’s been able to expand the business with help from the loans.  Her dream is to expand the business.
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - September, 2013.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Hassani, who is in his early 40s, is divorced and staying with his three girls, all of whom are in school. For eight years now, Hassani has been managing his life by running two businesses: a food shop (selling rice, flour, beans, sugar, cooking oil etc.) and a concrete business. He is doing fine with his family and businesses. He starts working from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to restock his food shop. Hassani dreams that one day will be able to improve his food business by being able to produce all crops himself.
 
He will share this loan with his loan group, Ujamaa, which consists of nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock his food shop.

loans.name: La Barranca Group

texts.es:
La señora Nelida Emilsa es de estado civil casada. Cuenta con 33 años de edad. De escolaridad primaria completa.
Tiene 2 hijos y 1 de ellos esta estudiando. Se dedica al a comprar y vender ponchos y chamarras de tapachula. Inició este negocio con un préstamo que le concedieron y a la fecha lleva 12 años de expericnecia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de chamarras y ponchos para revenderlos. Desea en el futuro ser una proveedora reconocida y poder vender por mayor.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y actividades agropecuarias.

Una de las socias no pudo asistir cuando tomaron la foto.
texts.en:
Nélida Emilsa, 33, is married and completed primary school.  She has two children one of which attends school.  She works buying and selling jackets and ponchos from Tapachula.  She started the business with a  loan she was granted and to date has 12 years’ experience.  She can count on her husband’s support; he’s a merchant.

She organized a group and requested a loan she’ll use to buy jackets and ponchos to resell.  She hopes in future to become a well-known supplier and to be able to sell at wholesale..

The other group members work in commerce and in agriculture.  One of the members was unable to be present when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy Tapachula ponchos and jackets.

loans.name: Tufaidi Group

texts.en:
Zana, who is in her early thirties, is single.  She has been running a pharmacy business since 2009.  She works from 8:00 AM to 10:00 PM daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Zana's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use the loan to buy more medicines and to expand the pharmacy shop to two rooms instead of one room.  She dreams of opening a another pharmacy in a different place.

Zana will share this loan with her Tufaidi loan group,  which has twelve members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more medicines and to expand the pharmacy shop to two rooms instead of one room.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as determined. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, cabbages, and other groceries. She describes her biggest business challenge as the lack of enough water storage facilities. 

Lucy will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy a  water tank to store sufficient clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will grow economically and sustain her family and business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es: Yesica de 25 años de edad, genera ingresos mediante varias actividades comerciales, por un lado vende prendas de acero, comercializa con ropa y también ofrece servicios de llamadas a celulares. Yesica aprendió de sus padres que son comerciantes de calzado y ella desde muy pequeña optó por ayudarlos en algunas temporadas, pues tienen un local comercial ubicado en el centro de la ciudad. Ella realiza ventas mediante guías especializadas de productos, utilizando un canal directo a su clientela. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y de contado en una jornada que inicia desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Su meta mas adelante es emprender un almacén de productos de belleza y peluquería y finalmente terminar su carrera profesional, Su mayor desafío es que sus recursos no son suficientes para cumplir sus sueños de prosperidad. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos de belleza, como tintes, champoo, masajes, maquillajes, pestañinas, acondicionador y variados productos capilares. Con su credikiva logrará diversificar su oferta de artículos, con productos que sus clientes solicitan y antes no lograba adquirir, y esto es justamente el éxito de su credikiva, pues adiciona un capital fresco a su pequeño capital de inversión..
texts.en:
Yesica, 25, earns income doing a variety of commercial activities.  On one hand she sells steel items, clothes and also offers mobile phone services.  She learned from her parents who are shoe merchants and she decided while still very young to help them out some seasons since they have a store downtown.

She sells directly to her customers via catalogs that specialize in products.  She sells on credit and for cash and her work day starts at 8 in the morning and continues until 10 at night.  Her goal for later on is to open a store to sell beauty and barber supplies and to finally complete her professional career.  Her greatest challenge is not having sufficient resources to reach her dream of prosperity.

This is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she’ll use to buy beauty products like dye, shampoo, massage products, make-up, eyelashes, conditioner and various hair-care products.  Her Kiva loan will make it possible for her to vary her inventory with products her customers request and she was unable to get previously.  This is precisely what will make her Kiva loan successful for she’ll add fresh capital to her small investment capital.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Rosestella

texts.es: Rosestella de 29 años de edad, habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 19 años, al suroccidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla, en un barrio cuyas familias en mayor parte generan ingresos independientes para el sostenimiento de sus hogares. Rosestella hace mas de dos años  trabajó para una empresa como empleada y cuando esta cerró sus puertas, ella debió generar ingresos de otra manera; así fue como hace 2 años, empezó invirtiendo su liquidación en mercancías variadas, como ropa y electrodomésticos menores, poco a poco construyó su clientela y ha ido cambando los artículos en la medida que lo requieran sus clientes, por eso vende hoy, productos de belleza y mercancías varias, pero quiere agregar  la línea de calzado y nuevamente electrodomésticos menores, pues tiene muchos pedidos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el que invertirá en calzado, electrodomésticos menores, perfumería, productos de aseo personal y ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Su meta es lograr que sus clientes paguen en corto tiempo y ubicar mas adelante un punto comercial tipo miscelánea y a nivel familiar continuar mejorando las condiciones habitacionales de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosestella, 29, lives with her spouse and two children who are 3 and 19 years of age in southwest Barranquilla in a neighborhood where most of the families earn income independently to support their homes.

Two years ago Rosestella was employed by a firm but when it went out of business she had to generate income some other way and that’s how two years ago she started to buy various merchandise like clothes and small home appliances that was on clearance sale and gradually built a clientele.  As her customers request, she varies the merchandise she stocks so today she sells beauty products and varied merchandise but she wants to add shoes and small home appliances again because she has many pending orders.

This is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy shoes, small home appliances, perfumery, personal hygiene products, and clothes for women, men and children.  Her business goal is to succeed in getting her customers to pay on time and later on to open a variety store and on the family front, to continue improving her house’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nzadze

texts.en: Nzadze is a married woman who has been blessed with six children. She lives in a house that she owns which has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. She earns a living by selling charcoal out of her house to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation. She is requesting a loan for Kshs 50,000 to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell. She joined Yehu because of the financial support it provides to entrepreneurs like her.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Mwanatibu

texts.en:
Mwanatibu has operated a cashew-nuts selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Here again she comes to you requesting a loan to purchase two sacks of cashew-nuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the support granted.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of cashew nuts for sale.

loans.name: Fredis Armando

texts.es:
Fredis, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por más capital de trabajo en  la fabricación de muebles de madera; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar madera y pintura para llevar a cabo su actividad y luego venderlo a sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le permitió fortalecer su negocio y con las ganancias a podido apoyar a su familia y cancelar sus préstamos, su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Fredis needs to opt for more working capital to manufacture wood furniture.  This investment will help him buy wood and paint to carry out his activity and then sell to his customers.

His previous loan made it possible for him to strengthen his business and used profits to help him family and to repay his loans.  His dream is to make the business grow and provide better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy lumber and paint.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman who has three children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past five years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. Umazi dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sweets, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil

loans.name: Zoila Gloria

texts.es:
Zoila, es una persona de hogar y vive con su esposo, su madre y sus hijos. Ella, se dedica a la venta de artículos del hogar, dicha actividad la aprendió de sus familiares y tiene varios años de realizarlo junto con su compañero de vida. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar algunos artículos y comprar pintura para pintar su casa; esta inversión le ayudara a adquirir mercadería  necesaria y con ello generar ingresos.
Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y ampliarla, agregar otro tipo de producto a su negocio y crecer como microempresario.
texts.en:
Zoila’s lives with her husband, mother and children; she’s devoted to her home.  She sells items for the home having learned this activity from her family members.  She’s been in business for several years and does it alongside her life companion.

The loan she needs will make it possible for her to buy some items and to buy paint to paint her house.  This investment will help her acquire merchandise to generate income with.

Her dream is to enlarge and improve her home and to add other types of merchandise to her business to grow as a micro businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy paint and some merchandise.

loans.name: Jose Rufino

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de optar porque requiere de más capital de trabajo en el cultivo de granos básicos, tales como: maíz y frijol; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los materiales agrícolas, como lo son: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a adquirir los insumos agrícolas para su cultivo y así ha logrado aportar para su familia; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: Jose needs more  working capital to grow basic grains, such as corn and beans. This investment will help him to buy agricultural supplies, such as fertilizer, herbicide, and pesticides, among other things. The previous loan helped him to get farming supplies for his crops and this way he was able to provide for his family. The economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pesticides, among other things.

loans.name: Xochil Mercedes

texts.es: Xochil es originaria de la ciudad de León. De 24 años de años de edad y soltera. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, desde hace mucho tiempo. Inicio esta actividad junto al apoyo de su familia. Solicita el crédito para comprar: blusas, camisas, vestidos, pantalones, calcetas, ropa interior, entre otros con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda para mejorar su  calidad de vida, ya que podrá invertir en su negocio y diversificar sus productos.  Su plan futuro es expandir su negocio y mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, brindado comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Xochil is from the city of León. She is 24 years old and single. She has been working in retail, selling new clothing, for a long time. She started this business with her family's support. She is requesting this loan to buy blouses, shirts, dresses, pants, socks, underwear, and other items in order to meet her customers' needs. She expects the loan to be of great help for her to improve her quality of life, because it will allow her to invest in her business and diversify her products. Her plans for the future are to expand her business and improve her home's infrastructure, offering her customers confort.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, dresses, pants, socks, underwear, and other items.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Here is Nancy from Liberia.  She is 37 years old and lives in Logan Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known.  Nancy is a widow and has three children between the ages of 3 and 20. Only two of her children are presently in school and live at home. Nancy is a second grade dropout. 

For the past 10 years, Nancy has been running a table where she sells washing and bath soaps. She started this business with a little money she saved and learned this ways of selling from her friends.  She likes her business because she makes a lot of profits and it keeps her busy. She is requesting a loan to buy more washing and bath soaps for her business.  Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more washing and bath soaps for her business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Twenty-four-year old Helen is from Liberia. To be precise, she lives in Long Town with her boyfriend and three children, between the ages of 3 months and 6 years old. Only two of her children are in school.

Helen has been running a table where she sells freezing chicken to make ants meal. She says with her business they are able to send their children to school. She says they started this business with money from her oldest brother.  She is requesting a loan to buy more freezing chicken for her business. Her plans are to expand her business even more and, in the future, to see her children attend university.

loans.use: to buy more freezing chicken for her business.

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Mamusu from Waterloo 2 Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of two years and seven years old. In 2000, Mamusu established her slipper sales business. She began her business because she wanted generates her own source of income.   She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mamusu requires a loan in order to purchase more slippers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Mamusu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Valerian

texts.en:
Valerian is from the Sachkere district. He lives with his wife, 21-year-old son, and 27-year-old daughter. Valerian and his son work on renovation of houses. They both earn 300 Gel per month. His daughter graduated from pharmaceutical college and works as a pharmacist. In addition, the family runs an agricultural business. They have land where they grow different crops to sell.

Valerian decided to get a loan and open a pharmacy, which his daughter will run. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and MFO Credo, gives him a chance to get a loan of $3,500 for opening the pharmacy. Valerian will use the loan to purchase medicines and raw materials to make shelves. This will give the family a chance to be involved in their own business and earn a more stable income.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and raw materials for shelves

loans.name: Kuwatiningsih

texts.en:
This is the story of Neffa, daughter of Kuwatiningsih:

I live in Kawunganten city of the district, a weak economic environment. My mother worked as a laborer. This program is very helpful because I am really poorer. I go to school by walking because the distance from home to school is only 500 meters. 

I love learning accounting because this subject is easy to learn and easy to get work if we have that accounting skill. I hope I will be a talented student in this vocational school. 

After I come back from school, I usually take a rest for a while; I do my homework, and then I help my parents to do housework. This loan is very helpful and very useful for me; that’s why I want to say thank you a lot for this program and all of the lenders.
In the picture, Neffa and her mother, Kuwatiningsih.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Narsum

texts.en:
This is the story of Nismanto, son of Narsum:

After graduating from junior high school, I planned to continue my study in vocational school, but my parents had trouble funding it. My father was just a laborer with uncertain monthly income. For everyday life, sometimes still lacking. My father was old enough to work as a laborer, helping my mom as a laborer. Both don’t have a stable income. I live in a small village named Cilopadang. On average people live simply, they work as farm laborers. I want to finish my school in order to help my parents. I hope there will be a way to solve my problem.
In the picture, Nismanto and his father, Narsum.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas is taking a $600 loan to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy basic items every day. She will use the loan to buy some additional stock of items such as noodles, sagiko, fanta, coca cola, sprite, beer, cigarettes, egg, oil, water, slippers, and biscuits. She has been involved in business activities since 2000. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Domingas independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: buy noodles, sagiko, fanta, coca cola, sprite, beer, cigarettes, egg, oil, water, and slippers.

loans.name: Bom's Group

texts.en: Bom is a mother in her late 40s and blessed with four children who are in school. Her entire farming mainly relies on her cassava farming on about a two-hectare area. The current business has generated about 47,000 KHR per day for her. Bom is a third time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely to support her business promptly. Now, in a group of three, she is the leader. For Bom, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay the plowing fee and weeding fee. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crop and make more profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay the plowing fee and weeding fee

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy de 49 años, es casado, padre de 3 hijos,  de los cuales 2 estudian en la escuela 6° y 8° la esposa se dedica al trabajo agrícola y a los oficios domésticos los 3 hijos viven en su casa. El señor siempre se ha dedicado al trabajo de la agricultura y la ganadería 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, pesticidas y herbicidas. 
Su deseo, es comprar e invertir más en ganadería y dejarle a su familia algo propio, para que puedan seguir trabajando si ellos no quisieran seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Fredy, 49, is married and father of three children two of which attend 6th and 8th grade.  His wife works in agriculture and doing domestic chores.  The three children live at home.  He’s always worked in agriculture and animal husbandry.

The loan he’s requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy fertilizer, pesticide and herbicide.  His wish is to buy and invest more in cattle to leave his family something of their own so that they can continue working if they don’t want to continue in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and herbicide.

loans.name: Aliyah

texts.en:
This is the story of Feni, daughter of Aliyah:

I’m the oldest child in my family. My mother worked as a laborer to help her father. My father works as a laborer whose income is uncertain.  Meanwhile, my father has to fund my siblings who are still studying in elementary school and junior high. 

I don’t want to be more of a burden to my parents, but I still want to continue my study further. I’ll be glad if there is someone who can help me.
In the picture, Feni and her mother, Aliyah.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university fees.

loans.name: Vicente Narcizo

texts.es:
El señor Vicente Narcizo tiene la edad de 43 años, es divorciado y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad, se dedica a su taller de vulcanizadora (reparación y colocación de llantas para carros)  tiene ya mas de 11 años dedicándose a su negocio.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la colocación de la losa de concreto en el local donde tiene su negocio, ya que le esta haciendo falta el techo, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la compara del materia y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Desea mejorar su local antes de que llegue la temporada de lluvia y de invierno y así tener protegidas sus herramientas y los carros que tiene que reparar.
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio es para pagar el credito y la otra parte es para los gastos familiares y escolares de sus hijos ya que están estudiando la secundaria.
texts.en:
Vicente Narcizo, 43, is divorced and has two children in his care. He has a workshop where he repairs and replaces auto tires, a business he has operated for more than 11 years. He has applied for a loan to lay a concrete floor in his business, which also lacks a roof, because he doesn't have the money to buy materials and pay laborers to make the improvements.

He wants to renovate his shop before the rainy season and winter so that he can protect his tools and the cars he needs to repair. He will use part of the profit to make his loan payments and the other part to pay his family's household and his children's middle-school expenses.

loans.use: to lay a concrete floor in his business.

loans.name: Noëlie's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représente du groupe, nommée Noëlie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 31 ans. Noëlie n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Noëlie est mariée à Venance, un plombier. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Noëlie vit seule avec son enfant. Les charges du ménage sont assumées par Noëlie. Pour subvenir à ces besoins et à ceux de son enfant, Noëlie vend divers articles (lait, savon, huile, sucre etc.) et des produits de toilette dans sa région depuis huit ans. Noëlie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Noëlie s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Noëlie (the one who has her hand raised in the photo) is 31 years old. Noëlie did not go to school. Noëlie is married to Venance, a plumber. The couple has one child, in school and under their care. Noëlie lives alone with her child. The household responsibilities are taken care of by Noëlie. To meet these needs and those of her child, Noëlie has been selling a variety of items (milk, soap, oil, sugar etc.) and toiletries in her region for eight years. Noëlie gets her supplies in a market in Bénin. With the goal of strengthening her business, Noëlie joined the other members of her group to request a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items (milk, soap, oil, sugar etc.) and toiletries.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina, 58, is married and blessed with five children. Four of her children are settled in marriage; the other is single and working.

Josefina has operated her general store for over 20 years. She is thankful, because her general store has expanded due to improvements in her financial stability. She would like continuous growth for her general store to earn a greater income and supply all of her customer demands.

With her determination to obtain her goal, she is requesting a loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos.This amount will be used to buy grocery stock, such as cooking oil, soft drinks, eggs, vegetables and meat.

Josefina knows that, by having a complete stock of groceries to sell, her business will be profitable and a viable source of family income.

loans.use: to buy grocery stock for her general store, such as cooking oil, soft drinks, eggs, vegetables and meat

loans.name: Clisanta

texts.es:
La señora Clisanta tiene  64 años de edad es madre soltera con 08 hijos  tres de ellos dependen de ella, vive en su casa ubicada en una colonia de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, donde vende la mercadería con la ayuda de una hija.
Doña Clisanta vende  ropa usada clasificada para niños y adultos además de vender en su casa también sale a vender ambulante a varios lugares de San Lorenzo
Doña Clisanta está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de fardos de ropa americana como blusas, pantalones, vestidos, camisetas, calzonetas, etc. y achinería plástica  ya que desea hacer más grande su negocio, de esta manera espera  tener más ganancias y así seguir apoyando a su hija que también es madre soltera con tres hijos, y su deseo es apoyarle  a que pueda construir la casa en donde pueda crecer a sus tres hijos.
Doña clisanta es muy perseverante y esforzada que ha logrado salir adelante sola y mantener a sus hijos que es un gran ejemplo para todos  y como cliente es excelente muy puntual en sus pagos solicita su sexto  préstamo.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Clisanta, 64, is a single mother with eight children. Three of them are dependents. She lives in her home, located in a neighborhood of San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras, where she sells merchandise with the help of a daughter. Clisanta sells used clothing for children and adults. In addition to selling out of her home, she also goes out to sell in various areas of San Lorenzo. Clisanta is asking for the loan to buy bundles of American clothing like blouses, pants, dresses, shirts, swim trunks, etc., as well has low-cost plastic knickknacks since she wants to expand her business. This way, she hopes to have more income and continue to support her daughter, who is also a single mother with three children. Her wish is to support her so that she can build a house to raise her three children. Clisanta is resolute and strong, so she has been able to move forward on her own and support her children. She is a great example for everyone and as a client, she is excellent. She makes her payments on time. She is asking for her sixth loan.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2013.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, dresses, shirts, swimming trunks, and more for her business

loans.name: Pélagie Geneviève's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représente du groupe, nommée Pélagie Geneviève (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 49 ans. Pélagie Geneviève n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pélagie Geneviève est mariée à Rodolphe. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pélagie Geneviève vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges du ménage sont assumées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Pélagie Geneviève vend divers articles (savon, huile, sucre etc.) et des tissus par la méthode de distribution depuis six ans. Pélagie Geneviève s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Pélagie Geneviève s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Pélagie Geneviève (the one who has her hand raised in the photo) is 49 years old. Pélagie Geneviève did not go to school. Pélagie Geneviève is married to Rodolphe. The couple has three children, all in school and under their care. Pélagie Geneviève lives with her husband and her children. The household responsibilities are taken care of by the couple. To do this, Pélagie Geneviève has been selling a variety of items (soap, oil, sugar etc.) and fabric through the distribution system for six years. Pélagie Geneviève gets her supplies in a market in Bénin. With the goal of strengthening her business, Pélagie Geneviève joined the other members of her group to request a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items (soap, oil, sugar etc.) and fabric.

loans.name: Honoraria

texts.en:
Honoraria is a single mom of an only child. She worked as a waiter in town to support the needs of her child. She joined GDMPC to gain access to microfinance services of the cooperative. 

She borrowed a loan of 7,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) to start her own retail business. In this amount of money, she will buy canned goods, kitchen and home use products to sell. She wants to make a business of her own to augment their living and to have a better future with her child.

loans.use: she will buy canned goods, kitchen and home use products to sell

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna, a 46-year old mother is from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married to a farmer and has a daughter who is 16 years old.  She finds her livelihood through selling cassava and banana in the market for six years now. She is asking for a loan to buy more banana and cassava that she can resell. Her income provides food for her family as well as tuition for her child.

She will reinvest some of her profits into the the same business and she hopes to introduce more variety of root crops to sell in the future.

loans.use: to buy more banana and cassava

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is from the community of Talibon - a town at the nortwest part of the province of Bohol. She is 64 years old. She is engaged in fishing and also has operated a Sari-sari (variety) store business for 48 years now. Cirila is asking for a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy fish nets, canned goods, toiletries, seasoning and chips to increase her inventory.

She hopes that, in the future, she can make her business sustainable and save enough for her future needs.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, canned goods, toiletries, seasoning and chips

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for additional used, but quality clothing needed in his business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Irene has been in this business for 29 years. Irene earns more income from a flower shop.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.es: Arnulfo, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 62 años de edad,  y vive solo actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Arnulfo, 62, is an enterprising man living alone at present.  He requested a loan hoping to buy supplies like manure and fumigation.  He wants to provide care for his coffee crop aiming at keeping them in good condition during their growth so that good quality product will be obtained.  This gentleman’s only limitation is the lack of money to continue growing since he depends on this activity to be able to continue moving forward.  This is why he’s requesting a loan, his first from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a hard-working woman, who works hard to facilitate the life of her family and to boost their living standard. The previous loan helped her to purchase ingredients for juice preparation. Here again, she comes to you requesting a loan. This time, the amount she is borrowing is KES 40,000, and she will use it to buy more fruits, sugar and squash, for her juice business. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, sugar and squash, for her fresh juice business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to grow coffee.

loans.name: N'sii Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bitasimwa est âgée de 49 et mère d’un enfant. Mariée à un enseignant. La cliente est la présidente du groupe de crédit « N’sii ». Elle est vendeuse ambulante des imperméables. Il y a deux ans qu’elle pratique cette activité et cela à partir du prêt reçu de Hekima. Ce nouveau prêt lui servira à acheter 20  bâches et ainsi supporter les études de son enfant.  La cliente projette acheter une parcelle et y construire confortablement. Ses remerciements s’adressent à Hekima pour son soutien aux pauvres non bancables.
texts.en: The client Bitasimwa is 49 years old, mother to one child and married to a teacher. The client is the president of the loan group N’sii. She is an itinerant saleswoman selling raincoats. She has been in this business for two years due to a loan received from Hekima. This new loan will allow her to buy 20 tarpaulins and thus to support her child's studies. The client plans to buy a plot of land and build there comfortably. Her thanks are addressed to Hekima for its support to poor nonbankable people.

loans.use: to buy 20 tarpaulins.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi appreciated her previous loan, which improved her living standard. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

Now, she would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of KES 40,000. She will use it to buy household consumables to sell at her stand, such as wheat flour, oil, bread, rice and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy household consumables to sell at her stand, such as wheat flour, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pepper and cinnamon, among others.

loans.name: Hilda Mabel

texts.es:
Hilda, le surge la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en su actividad; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar cinco quintales de maíz y así vender más tortillas a sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le permitió establecer su negocio y continuar trabajando para consolidarse como vendedor, asimismo le ayudo a mejorar la presentación en el negocio.
texts.en: Hilda finds the need to apply for another loan, as she needs more working capital to continue with her business. This loan will help her to buy five quintals of corn and so sell more tortillas to her customers. The previous loan allowed her to set up her business and carry on working to become established as a seller. It also helped her to improve the appearance of her business.

loans.use: to buy five quintals of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase compost, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide and other items.

loans.name: Rosa Marina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, porque los créditos son una fuente que ayuda al rendimiento y obtener excelentes utilidades, también por el servicio que la Institución le brinda; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar puertas de balcón y asimismo para el negocio, frutas y verduras.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar sus inventarios y un mejor servicio a sus clientes; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en: Rosa needs to opt for a new loan because the loans are a source of support that helps her earn higher profits and also because of the good service she gets from the institution.  This investment will help her buy balcony doors as well as fruit and vegetables for the business.  Her previous loan helped her increase her inventory and provide better customer service.  Her economic conditions and family circumstances have become optimal.

loans.use: to buy balcony doors, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Ana Josabet

texts.es:
Ana, es una persona trabajadora y está acompañada, no posee hijos. Ella, se dedica a la agricultura, como lo es: cultivo de granos básicos, maíz y frijol, asimismo a la crianza de ganado y cerdos, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, oficio que lo aprendió de sus padres y para llevarlo a cabo contrata personad de forma eventual.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar los materiales agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a adquirir todos los insumos agrícolas para realizar el cultivo.
Su sueño es apoyar a su familia con los gastos económicos  y continuar trabajando en la tierra.
texts.en: Ana is a hard worker and has a life partner, though she has no children. She grows crops like grains, corn, and beans and also raises cattle and pigs. She learned her trades, which she has been doing for 10 years, from her parents, and she hires workers at times. She has applied for a loan to buy farming supplies like manure, herbicide, pesticide, and more. This loan will help her buy all the supplies she needs for planting. She dreams of helping her family with expenses and continuing to work her land.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicide, pesticide, and more.

loans.name: Lieu

texts.en:
Lieu is a 45-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. Her husband is a security guard for a bookstore.

Lieu has successfully repaid a previous loan through CEP that enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She is now applying for a new loan of 20,000,000 VND to buy a range of goods such as sugar, cooking oils and sauces to restock her general store. This will help her to meet better the needs of her customers. 

Lieu hopes that her new loan will help her increase the size of her store and sales. She is working to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of goods with which to restock her general store

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen would like to take a further loan, to buy animal feed and pay the school fees of her children. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Yen hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business further. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and pay the school fees of her children

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos es un joven de 20 años de edad, vive con sus padres, propietarios de un local arrendado donde funciona una tapicería, pero, el arrendatario va a entregar el local, por lo que él desea aprovechar esta oportunidad y montar su propio negocio de ebanistería, actividad que aprendió de su familia y en el colegio, así pretende generar los recursos necesarios para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Cuenta con la ventaja de que el local está bien ubicado y es reconocido en el sector. El cliente es un joven activo, dinámico, emprendedor y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, razón que lo impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para comprar los activos fijos (sierra sinfín, caladora, delineadora y torno), con esto podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo, del cual espera obtener buenos resultados para seguir avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de sus objetivos y más adelante poder generar oportunidades de empleo. Carlos sabe que para lograr lo que sueña, debe trabajar arduamente, con empeño, disciplina y mucha dedicación, sólo de esta manera podrá disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar en compañía de sus padres.
texts.en: Carlos is 20 and lives with his parents, they own an upholstery shop at a location they rent, but the landlord is giving back the space, because of this he wants to take advantage of the opportunity and start his own business doing woodwork, activity that he learned from his family and in school, this way he plans to generate the resources needed to contribute to his home's economy.  His advantage is that the location is good and recognized in the area.  He is an active, dynamic, entrepreneurial young man, and he really wants to get ahead, reason why he wants to request a credit to buy fixed assets (band saw, jig-saw, draw knife and lathe), with this he will be able to start is project, where he hopes to obtain good results to continue moving forward achieving his objectives and later on be able to generate employment opportunities for others.  Carlos knows that to achieve his dreams he has to work hard, with determination, discipline and diligence; only this way he will be able to enjoy a better quality of life and well being with his parents.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (band saw, jig-saw, draw knife and lathe)

loans.name: Javier Osvaldo

texts.es: Javier tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y padre de un hijo de 5 años. Desde hace 20 años se desempeña como agricultor independiente, actividad que aprendió de su familia cuando era pequeño, pues ha sido una tradición familiar que ha pasado de generación en generación. Desde hace 8 meses  incursionó en la floricultura como una opción para complementar sus ingresos, ofreciendo diversidad de productos en el mercado. Actualmente posee cultivos de fríjol y papa, ubicados en un terreno familiar y además tiene cultivo de hortensias en un terreno arrendado. Cuenta con el apoyo de un trabajador que emplea al jornal y en tiempo de siembras y recolección de cosecha contrata a otras 2 personas más. El cliente es un hombre perseverante, activo y muy trabajador, siempre busca opciones que le permitan avanzar, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos externos como los altos costos de los insumos que requiere y el invierno que en varias ocasiones ha dañado sus cultivos, afectando directamente sus finanzas. El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de semillas, abonos, riegos y fertilizantes que le permitan darle continuidad a su labor y sacar una cosecha más productiva, que pueda ser vendida a mejor precio en el mercado, aumentando sus ingresos de manera notable. Javier desea cumplir sus metas, fortaleciendo su negocio para que sea más rentable y así mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Javier, 38, is married and father of a five-year-old son.  He’s worked independently in agriculture for 20 years, an occupation he learned from his family when he was a boy.  It’s been a family tradition that’s been passed town from generation to generation.

Eight months ago he started to grow flowers as a way to earn extra income.  He offers a variety of products in the market.  He currently grows beans and potatoes on a piece of family land and he also grows hortense flowers on leased land.  He gets help from an employee he hires by the day and during planting and harvesting he hires to more people. 

He’s a persevering, active, very hardworking man who is always seeking opportunities to get ahead overcoming various external obstacles like the high cost of supplies he needs and winter which occasionally has damaged his crops directly affecting his finances.

The loan he’s requesting will be used to buy seed, manure, irrigation and fertilizer to give continuity to his work and obtain a more abundant harvest that will command a higher market price significantly increasing his income.  Javier wants to reach his goals strengthening his business so that it will be more profitable thus improving his family’s quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is 31 years old.  She is married and lives in Gardnersville of Montserrado County, which is the commercial city of Liberia.  She has two children, ages 3 and 5.  Only one is in school.  Cynthia stopped her education at 11th grade.  For the past three years, she has been selling pepper, vita, salt, onion, palm oil, etc. at a table in the local market.  She started this business from her savings from selling boiled eggs.  She likes the ways her customers buy from her and the profit she generates each day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, vita, salt, onion, palm oil, etc. for her business.  In the near future, she wants to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, vita, salt, onion, palm oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Vuthny's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Vuthny is 36 years old and married. She and her husband have two children who are still in school. She and her husband earn a living through working as construction workers in the local area. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 18,000 KHR per day to support her family.
 
This is the first loan for Vuthy with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Vuthny will use her portion to buy construction supplies for her family’s business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for her family’s business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Napoleón

texts.es:
Napoleón de 37 años de edad, esta casado tiene tres hijos de 15, 14 y 11 años de edad y todos asisten a la escuela. Napoleón dejo de estudiar, porque se decidió trabajar para  ayudar económicamente a sus padres.

Tiene casi 30 años de trabajar en la agricultura, oficio que aprendió cuando decidió dejar de estudiar y dedicarse a trabajar junto a su padre. Actualmente, sigue siendo agricultor, camina aproximadamente 1 km desde su casa hasta llegar al lugar donde tiene su cultivo, cuando puede le ayuda su hijo mayor.

El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de agroquímicos,  tiene sembrado 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz que necesitan ser fertilizadas.

El deseo mas grande de Napoleón es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios, para que puedan gozar de una vida que él no pudo tener, también piensa seguir trabajando como agricultor pero espera poder cubrir mas área de siembra.
texts.en:
Napoleón, 37, is married with three children who are 15, 14 and 11 years old; all attend school.  Napoleón dropped out of school because he decided to work to help his parents economically.  He’s been working in agriculture for nearly 30 years, an occupation he learned when he left school to work with his father.  He continues working in agriculture to this day.  He walks about one kilometer from home to reach his fields and his oldest son help him when he can.

He will use the loan to buy chemicals.  He has 14,000 square meters of corn that needs to be fertilized.  His greatest wish is that his children complete their schooling so that they can enjoy a life he was unable to.  He also plans to continue working in agriculture but hopes to plant a larger area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es:
Ana de 37 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 17 años de edad, ambos estudian, además de ser ama de casa, se levanta todos los días a las 4 de la mañana para realizar actividades agrícolas junto a con su esposo.

Ana tiene ganado en su casa, se dedica a cuidarlo y producir leche para vender y contribuir con los ingresos de la familia. Trabaja con animales desde que era niña, su padre era ganadero y aprendió el oficio viendo como trabajaba él.

El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de dos vacas lecheras, con ello aumentara la producción de leche y tiene planeado vender derivados como: queso, quesillo, cuajada, requesón y crema.

Dentro de los planes de Ana están la compra de un terreno para tener el ganado, ya que no lo puede tener en su casa y se ve obligada a alquilar un lugar para tenerlo y esto le genera un gasto.
texts.en:
Ana, 37, is married with two children who are 10 and 17 years old.  Both attend school.  In addition to being a housewife, she rises every day at 4 in the morning to do agricultural chores with her husband.

Ana has cattle at home that she cares for to produce milk to sell and contribute to family income.  She’s worked with animals since she was a little girl.  Her father was a cattleman and she learned the occupation watching him work.

She will use the loan to buy two dairy cows to increase milk production.  She also plans to sell derivatives like cheese, string cheese, curd, cream cheese and cream.

Among Ana’s plans is to buy land for pasture because she can’t do so at home and has to lease a place to keep it thus incurring an expense.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Nayrobi Jose

texts.es: Nayrobi es un joven de 32 años de edad que vive en una comunidad donde no hay energía eléctrica. Él se trasladó hace seis años a esa comunidad luego de que su suegra le ofreciera unas tierras para que las trabajara y mejorara la calidad de vida que tenía con su hija. En la comunidad anterior se le hacía muy difícil salir adelante con su esposa. Él tiene dos hijas las que van a la escuela de la comunidad. Él tiene una manzana de tierra donde siembra maíz y su producción la destina para la venta y autoconsumo. Además también trabaja en fincas cercanas. En la temporada de café, él viaja con su esposa a cortar café y obtiene un ingreso extra en los meses de noviembre, diciembre y enero. Con este ingreso extra ellos logran comprar los útiles del hogar del año escolar de sus niñas. En la comunidad no hay energía eléctrica y el señor Nayrobi desea poder brindarle a su familia iluminación para que sus niñas puedan estudiar de una mejor forma durante las noches.
texts.en:
Nayrobi, 32, lives in a community without electricity. He moved there six years ago after his mother-in-law offered his some land to plant so that he could improve his and his daughters' standard of living. He and his wife found it difficult to get ahead where they had been living. He has two daughters, who are students in a local school.

He has a manzana of land, where he grows corn to sell and for personal consumption, and he also works on nearby farms. He and his wife travel seasonally to cut coffee, which lets them earn extra income during November, December, and January. With the extra income, they are able to buy household and their daughters' annual school supplies. There is no electricity in their community, and Nayrobi wants to provide light for his family so that his girls can study better in the evening.

loans.use: to buy a small solar panel to provide light in his house.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos vive en una comunidad en Matagalpa que no tiene energía eléctrica. El trabaja en una finca cercana a su hogar. En su hogar vive con su esposa y seis hijos. Varios de sus hijos nacieron con problemas en su visión, no pueden ver. Uno de sus hijos de 10 años quien tiene problema en sus ojos está yendo a clases, va a segundo grado de la escuela. Carlos usualmente busca quien le alquile una vez al año una manzana de tierra para sembrar y cosechar maíz, el que utiliza para dar de comer a su familia durante todo el año. Él está solicitando un crédito para adquirir un pequeño sistema solar que le permita tener iluminación en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in a community in Matagalpa that does not have electricity.  He's employed on a farm near his home.  At home he lives with his wife and six children.  Several of his children were born with vision problems; they cannot see.  One of his children who is 10-years-old and has vision problems is attending school; he’s in second grade.

Carlos usually looks for someone to lease him a ‘manzana’ [Central American unit of land measurement] of land to plant and grow corn that he uses to feed his family the entire year.  He’s asking for a loan to buy a small solar energy system in order to have light at home.

loans.use: to buy a small solar energy system.

loans.name: Isrrael Benjamin

texts.es:
Isrrael de 51 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 5 hijos con edades desde los 10 a los 25 años. Solo pudo estudiar hasta noveno grado, en la actualidad, trabaja la tierra junto con su esposa e hijos mayores y para hacerlo se levantan todos los días a la 5 de la mañana para aprovechar la mayor cantidad de horas frescas en el día.

Tiene cerca de 40 años de trabajar como agricultor, oficio que aprendió con su padre. Tiene ganado y este lo cuida su esposa, produciendo leche y vendiéndola para contribuir con los ingresos de la familia.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar un toro, que será utilizado para cargar la novillas que tiene y así renovar el lote de ganado.

Isrrael tiene como propósito comprar un terreno de buen tamaño, para  alojar ahí el ganado, ya que por el momento alquila uno y esto le genera gasto.
texts.en:
Isrrael, 51, is married with five children whose ages range between 10 and 25 years.  He was only able to complete 9th grade and currently works the land with his wife and older children.  To do so, they all rise at 5 in the morning to best take advantage of the day’s cool hours.

He’s been working in agriculture for nearly 40 years, an occupation he learned from his father.  He has cattle his wife cares for that produce milk that’s sold to contribute to family income.  

The loan will be used to buy a bull whose job will be to impregnate the heifers he has thus renewing his cattle herd.  Isrrael’s goal is to buy a good-sized plot of land to house the cattle because for the moment he must lease it thus incurring an expense.

loans.use: to buy a stud bull.

loans.name: Wilver Antonio

texts.es:
Wilver de 36 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su madre y su hermana, no tiene hijos, logro terminar sus estudios de educación media gracias al apoyo de su padre, quien ya falleció. 

Se dedica a trabajar la tierra desde los 14 años, aprendió con su padre quien lo llevaba a las fincas algodoneras a trabajar. Todavía trabaja la tierra, comparte el esfuerzo con un tío; al ser una persona emprendedora y con deseos de superarse, cuando no trabaja en su cultivo, vende medicinas, para ello hace visitas de puerta en puerta y así no depender directamente de la cosecha de maíz.

Wilver tiene sembradas 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizante, para así asegurar la cosecha del elote.

En un futuro Wilver tiene planeado construir su propia casa y seguir trabajando para a alimentar a la familia.
texts.en:
Wilver, 36, is single living with his wife and sister; he has no children.  He was able to complete secondary school thanks to his late father’s support.  He’s been working the land for 14 years having learned from his father who would take him to work in the cotton fields.  He still works the land and shares the work with an uncle.  Being an enterprising person who wants to improve when he’s not working on his crops he sells medicine door to door in order not to be completely dependent on the corn harvest.

Wilver has 21,000 square meters of corn planted and needs the loan to buy fertilizer to insure the corn harvest.  In future, Wilver plans to build his own house and to continue working to feed the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his corn crop.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: La señora Vilma reside en el municipio de Esquipulas. Llegó a vivir en 1971. Ella se graduó de profesora de educación. Trabajó por seis años en la escuela de la comunidad, luego la transfirieron a otra escuela como directora. Fungió por 18 años como directora en esa escuela. Luego tuvo que emigrar del país. Se fue a vivir a Estados Unidos donde vivió 32 años hasta que regresó a Nicaragua. Su hijo quien vive en Estados Unidos tiene una pequeña propiedad fuera del pueblo donde no hay energía eléctrica. En dicha propiedad viven dos jóvenes que cuidan la propiedad y doña Vilma quiere un crédito para comprar un panel solar y que puedan tener luz y vivir mejor
texts.en: Vilma lives in the municipality of Esquipulas; she arrived there in 1971.  She graduated as a teacher and worked for six years in a community school.  She was later transferred as Principal to another school.  She worked as Principal at that school for 18 years.  Later, she had to emigrate and went to live in the United States for 32 years and finally returned to Nicaragua.  Her son who lives in the United States has a small property outside town with no electricity.  Two young men who care for the property live there and Vilma wants a loan to buy a solar panel so they can have electricity to live better.

loans.use: to buy a home solar energy system.

loans.name: Karen Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora  Karen de 31 años de edad es casada vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una casa de habitación donde alquilan,  se dedica desde hace 04 años a el negocio de venta de abarrotería.
Doña Karen vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Karen está solicitando el préstamo para compra de arroz, azúcar, café, frijoles, pan, huevos, salsas, lácteos, churros, frescos, etc. y todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar.
Doña Karen con el apoyo de este préstamo  pretende mejorar sus ingresos y surtir más su negocio y por ende tener mejores ganancias que le ayudaren a salir adelante con su familia y sus proyectos, su sueño es tener su propia casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Karen, 31, is married and lives with her husband and two children in a rented house. She has operated a small grocery store for four years, and she sells all kinds of basic food items. She is hardworking and enterprising and wants to succeed. 

Karen has applied for a loan to buy rice, sugar, coffee, beans, bread, eggs, sauces, milk products, churros, beverages, and other basic food items. With this loan, Karen will try to increase her income and inventory so that she can achieve higher profits, which will help her provide for her family and fund her projects. She dreams of owning a house. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2013

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, beans, bread, eggs, sauces, milk products, churros, beverages, and more for her business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 56 years old and married with five children.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for ten years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Mary Jane aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Maria Teodora de 37 años de edad es soltera y se dedica a la venta  de refrescos y abarrotería, sus cliente son todo los amigos y vecinos de  su aldea, en su negocio vende lo  que son refrescos y  una gran variedad de productos de la canasta básica.
Doña María Teodora en su primer crédito se dedicaba a la venta de mariscos, con las ganancias que obtuvo  logro  poner una pulpería en su casa de habitación, esta solicitando el crédito para invertir en compra de agua, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, huevos, refrescos, etc. Su negocio esta ubicado en el municipio de Amapala en la parte sur de Honduras.
Doña María Teodora con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Septiembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Maria Teodora is 37 and single. She sells beverages and groceries. Her customers are her friends and neighbors. She sells beverages and a wide range of basic food items. María Teodora used her first loan to invest in her seafood business, and with her profits, she was able to open a small grocery store in her house.

She has applied for this loan to buy water, rice, sugar, beans, eggs, beverages, and more. Her business is located in the city of Amapala in southern Honduras. María Teodora will use her earnings and the funding to move forward and keep growing her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to buy water, rice, sugar, beans, eggs, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Thach

texts.en: Thach is requesting a new loan, to buy a greater quantity of goods like sugar and beverages, to restock her general store. Thach's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing further the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of goods, such as sugar and beverages, to restock her general store

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Do

texts.en:
Do's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She would like to take a further loan to buy animal feed for her pigs and ingredients to make soup to sell. 


Do hopes that another loan will help her increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that she can improve both her income and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for her pigs and ingredients to make soup to sell.

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 


Le hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing both the size of her store and her sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao would like to take another loan to buy more cows and animal feed, and to pay the school fees of her children. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Thao hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more cows and animal feed, and to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong would like to take a new loan to buy animal feeds and pay school fees for her children. Her previous one enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 


Phuong hopes that the new loan will help her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can improve both her income and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds and pay school fees for her children.
